story:
This is an event giving a platform for Legends to mentor an entertainer from our community. This is an opportunity to become intimate with Glitter Icons that paved the way for our art form and receive mentoring from the best that our community in unison have recognized for years of excellence in our field. 
This unique event unites seven Legends with seven chosen protege to compete against one another in the name of their mentoring Legend for the title of LEGENDS CHAMPION. 
Once chosen, Protege will receive the unique opportunity to be mentored, and mold a performance that best showcases the Legend and Protege.
Entertainers chosen as protege will be competing to receive a title, certificate of excellence signed by all Legends,an Heirloom bestowed from each Legend in addition to a paid returning performance the following year. A cash prize purse will be given to their mentoring Legend of the winner of the Legends Champion.
There will be 10 chosen protege. Seven competing for Champion and three alternate protege to replace the chosen seven in the event they can not compete. 
Title and prizes will be given for the Crowned Champion, runner up and Producers Pick.

We have picked our protege and are now raising money to bring Legend and protege alike to Los Angeles. Our legends have needs such as travel, accomodations and pay for performance that are having to be met in addition to the task of aiding in the expenses of their protege. 

We are asking for your help to bring this first of its kind festival to our community. Our legends have so much to give to our community lacking only the opportunity to do so. Support your legends and their brave and loving event today! 

We have been working so hard and the last stretch is here within our reach! Help our gorgeous Legends begin a tradition that will last many years to come.

story:
Helvetica Bold and Jolie Stripes to shimmy across Canada 

Both members of the Ottawa Burlesque Festival Committee, Stripes and Bold tirelessly volunteer their time towards expanding and enhancing burlesque in Ottawa. 
We are touring from Vancouver to Montreal to raise awareness of the Ottawa Burlesque Festival, and build bridges for the benefit of all Ottawa performers and fans.

Jolie Stripes, also called "Ottawa's French Kiss", has only few years of burlesque performing under her garterbelt, but this proud native from the province of Québec already graced stages all over Ontario and Quebec. She is one of the few independant performers from Ottawa, and her innate sensuality, her witty acts and her elaborate costumes also make her one of the most sought-after. She is also an active cosplayer and produced for two years G-Anime's official nerdlesque show. She is currently working for the Ottawa Burlesque Festival committee as francophone representative and official translator.

Helvetica Bold is one of the godmothers of the Ottawa burlesque community. As the founder of Ottawa's oldest and longest-running burlesque troupe, Rockalily, she's championed body acceptance within the burlesque industry through actively encouraging inclusivity of all sizes, genders, and abilities among performers and audience members. Helvetica has been on stages all across Ontario and Quebec in her 7 years as a burlesque performer, with career highlights such as participating in setting the world record for the longest burlesque show at Nuit Nude Blanche 2010 in Toronto; being included in Burlesque: l'art et le jeu de seduction, a coffee table book about burlesque history; performing at the first International Montreal Burlesque Festival; and producing Ottawa's first festival-style show, in 2012, Capital City Cabaret.


How will we use your donation?

This November, we are leaving from Montreal to visit Seattle for Burlycon. After Burlycon, we will make our way up to Vancouver and then spend the next month travelling by train, performing in various cities, Making our way back to Ottawa/Gatineau and spreading the good word of the Ottawa Burlesque Festival across the country.


What will your donation help us out with?

  • Travel - travel is not cheap, and burlesque is a labour of love. We've already paid our way to Seattle, but we need help getting across Canada. Our rail passes alone will cost just shy of $2000. We also need to plan for ground travel, like cab fare and metro tickets.
  • Accommodations - Ideally, we can stay with other performers in their towns, but sometimes that option is not available. 
  • Cost of living expenses - We still have rent to pay at home, plus the cost of living on the road for 5 weeks. 

The Impact

Burlesque is an iconic and unique art form from the early-mid 20th century that has been enjoying a resurgence that started in the 1990's, and propelled in the 2000's.

Burlesque allows entertainers to control every aspect of their performance. It is the intersection of sex and comedy; where feminism and satire are welcome, and where women run the show. 

Burlesque transforms theatres and nightclubs, and sometimes non-conventional art spaces, into a multi-sensory art experience that must be lived to understand.
We want to share this experience with the world!

We are sharing Ottawa's style with the rest of the nation in an effort to invite more performers to visit Ottawa for the upcoming Ottawa Burlesque Festival.

The more burlesque there is, the larger our audience will become. The larger the audience becomes, the more opportunity we have for performers. We are stimulating a growth cycle by touring, and your support is imperative to make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter!
  • Call your local burlesque producer and tell them you want them to book Jolie and Helvetica while we are on tour.
  • Have any chain hotel gift certificates or VIA Rail vouchers that you don't immediately need? We can use them!
  • Do you live in one of the cities we are visiting? Do you have a spare room that we may use for a few days?
  • Sponsor us! Financial and in-kind sponsorship are both welcome. We are happy to promote you or your brand in exchange for helping us out. 
  • Go to the theatre. Go see burlesque. Support your local burlesque artists, because that supports all of us in the long run.

Thank you!

Print photo by Bruce Deachman:

story:
What's a Batt and Men?

If you don't already know, Matt and Ben is an awesome play by Mindy Kaling and Brenda Withers.  In a nutshell, Matt and Ben discover the screenplay for Good Will Hunting after it falls from the sky into their laps one afternoon in Somerville.  Comedy ensues. 

We are Libby Schap and Lauren Robinson, two Boston based actresses who are planning to put on this awesome production at the Riot Theater in JP, Boston.

I know, I know, two girls playing bad boy hotties Matt Damon and Ben Affleck?  And they'll be switching off the roles at each performance?  Crazy.  But take a look at our credentials.  We're good, we swear.  (Plus it helps the talented Mindy Kaling and Brenda Withers wrote Matt and Ben to be played by women in the first place.)

Libby Schap - Libby's bio from pat and myra kill somebody.

Lauren Robinson - Lauren's ImprovBoston bio

We're going to pull off an awesome show, but what can make it better is your help...


Okay. What do you Need from ME?

Well, putting up a show costs money, and since we're doing this as an independent project, we don't have a pre-existing theater company to rely on for the dough.  What we'd like from you is your help with the funds.  They'll go to things like:

  • Rights to the show (because it's illegal if we don't)
  • A stage manager (because someone needs to keep us organized)
  • Props/set (because computers and couches aren't made of air)
  • Costumes (because we can't wear dresses)
  • Programs (because don't you want to know what's going on?)
  • Posters/Ad space (because people need to know about it)


Fine. But what do I get out of it?

What will you get? Some great perks depending on how much you donate- tickets to the show, song selection for a special musical bit, naming a random character... check it out.  Also, comedy gold.


Comedy Gold, You Say?

Yes.  Comedy Gold.  Which the world needs more of really.  Matt and Ben is a funny show, we like to think we're funny people, and we want to spread that funniness to as many other people as we can.  Really, can  you afford not to contribute to laughter and cross dressing?

 
Thank you everyone for considering to donate and viewing! 
We really appreciate your help!
- Lauren & Libby

story:
The Mikado: Reclaimed

Presented by Generic Ensemble Company in Partnership with The VORTEX
in conjunction with LuckyChaos

Directed by kt shorb
Featuring: JooHee Anh, Annie Hedrick, Jonathan Itchon, Abigail Lucas, Smalls McCoy, Rachel Steed, and Leng Wong.
Music Direction by Alex Hartley
Lighting Design by Shelby Gebhart
Costume Design by Lirit Pendell
Cosmetic Design by Amelia Turner
Scenic Design by Ann Marie Gordon
Stage Management by Suzanne Smith
Additional Music by Toshio Mana
Associate Production by Lemons Clemons

The Mikado: Reclaimed flips the Gilbert and Sullivan classic on its head, presenting an (almost) all-Asian American cast performing a devised theatre piece with select musical numbers from the (in)famous operetta. Set in an internment camp in the near future, internees seek humanity amidst racism, corruption, and xenophobia. Queer love stories mingle with examinations of yellowface and conflict as we reinvent the well-known characters of Yum-Yum, Nanki-poo, and Ko-Ko.   

Why This Project Now

In a political climate of over-crowded immigrant detention centers, calls for “Muslim Bans,” and the largest refugee crisis in decades, The Mikado: Reclaimed explores human resilience and liberation in the face of real and metaphorical confinement. We are devising our piece based on research of Japanese American internment during World War II, Syrian refugee camps, and family detention centers.

How We Will Use These Funds

Donations from this campaign will go directly toward paying creative collaborators, that include seven actors, a director, video director and crew, music director, a stage manager, four designers and other personnel. We have already received a grant from the City of Austin, which will cover much of our talent and materials costs. We are grateful to The VORTEX for underwriting our project through providing performance space and other material goods so we can direct most of our resources toward paying talent. It is our goal to pay each actor at least $500. The $3000 will insure that. It is the goal of the Generic Ensemble Company to make creative labor sustainable for all collaborators. Love makes art good, but you can't eat it. Money helps.

Let's Talk About Radical Rush

We are so proud to be partnering with The VORTEX on their Radical Rush program that reserves a bloc of free tickets in the spirit of sustainability, accessibility, and participating in the gift economy. Radical Rush tickets are released an hour before the performance starts--first come first serve. Your donation to this campaign allows us to offer our show to all patrons, regardless of their socio-economic status. 

Why We Are So Cool

The Generic Ensemble Company (GenEnCo) is one of the few troupes in Austin, and nationally, that centers people of color bodies and experiences in physically engaged, experimental, ensemble-based performance. GenEnCo has some grants and awards under its belt, and director, kt shorb, has presented work nationally. This is the most recent project aimed at asking profound questions toward social change through rigorous, dangerous, and community-conscious theatre. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help out with donating to our cause, we are looking for volunteers to run the house, be backstage, and distribute media material. Do you have a blog, radio show, or column? Talk to us and share our project with your audience!

Ticket Info

You can reserve a seat by going to The VORTEX ticketing page.

story:
University of Kent Players present 'Pride & Prejudice' this October for MS Therapy Centre

The University of Kent Players were founded by chairman Neil Hornsey in 2013 and is made up mostly of staff at the University of Kent. We put on two shows per year which all raise money for a local charity. In the past we have raised money for the Kent Association for the Blind, Catching Lives, the Battle of Britain Memorial and AgeUK. We are a relatively new and small amateur dramatics group but are continually growing.

This October we will be back at the Gulbenkian in Canterbury with Jane Austen's 'Pride & Prejudice,' adapted for the stage and directed by our very own Leila Sangtabi.

Due to unforeseen circumstances, the players are in need of a little financial help to make sure that Pride & Prejudice is the best it can be and that's where you come in! Your generous donations not only mean that you can grab some great exclusive experiences and goodies but also help us to put on a great show for you all and more importantly, raise as much money as possible for this production's chosen charity - the Kent MS Therapy Centre.

The Kent MS Therapy Centre offers first class facilities to support people affected by Multiple Sclerosis – those that have the condition, their families, friends and those who care for them. Some of our members have been affected by Multiple Sclerosis and so this charity is close to their hearts. Multiple Sclerosis (MS) is a disease of the central nervous system, which is often progressive. At present it remains incurable.

Tickets are on sale now from the Gulbenkian website and in person at the box office! Grab yours today before they're gone!

About the Production

This tale of love and values unfolds in class-conscious England in the late 18th century. The five Bennet sisters - including strong-willed Elizabeth - have been raised by their mother with one purpose in life: finding a husband. When the wealthy bachelor, Mr Bingley, takes up residence in nearby Netherfield, the Bennets are abuzz. Amongst Bingley’s sophisticated circle of friends, surely there will be no shortage of suitors for the Bennet sisters. But when Elizabeth meets up with the handsome and - it would seem - snobbish Mr. Darcy, the battle of the sexes begins.

This production has been adapted for the stage and directed by Leila Sangtabi. The original artwork for the poster was created by Assistant Director Corinne Smallman and film composer Chiara Fulgoni has composed original music for the show. Expect real regency dancing from Jane Austen's era taught to us by John at ContraFusion as well as beautiful costumes, set and heartwarming performances from our fabulous (if rather enormous) cast.

Previous productions from the University of Kent Players include Comic Potential, Cash on Delivery, A Murder is Announced, Flare Path and Murder Inn.

What We Need & What You Get

This production is our most ambitious production to date and is already in full swing with tickets on sale now. Any donations we receive will be much appreciated and as so, we do not have a specific target amount but would like to raise around £700 to cover all of our costs in the run up to opening night. We will then be able to donate a larger amount of ticket sale profit to our charity.

In return, apart from our expressed gratitude you can grab yourself some great goodies and experiences only available to our Indiegogo backers including Mr Darcy's backstage tour, Lizzie's regency dance class, goody bags and more!

Your donations will go towards the building of our fantastic set designed by Neil Hornsey and the creation of some beautiful costumes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to back us then don't worry, there are other ways you could help us to get to our target. Please share our campaign far and wide and tell all of your friends about the production! You can also grab some tickets from the Gulbenkian and come down to support us during our three night run.

To keep up to date with the Players then follow us on social media! We're on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram

story:
"The dance is a poem of wich each movement is a word."

When you hear the sound, maybe it's a music, When you feel a movement, maybe it's a dance, when you hear the music and see the movement, that's me, IOANA.
I dream with stories and I tell you my story, because everything that gives meaning to my day is a dance. 
With great honor that I am pleased to announce i've been selected for the Jump Dance competition in Chicago. Jump is the large dance convention is the world touring in USA cities and each event includes a workshops and the final competition. Is something that's high energy, fresh and innovate. Most importantly, it's an inspiring, educational event. Be select is to have the opportunity to win a scholarship for entrance to the best dancer competition at the dance awards Las Vegas or New York City. 
I was born on 14 of April 2000 in Bulgária. When I was a very small child, I flew to a new town with a lovely light. This city is Lisbon, Portugal. I Live in Lisbon since 2003 and I found it wonderful to love two cities. My education in dance started in 2004 when I start to practice rhytmic gymnastic and during 10 years I won many medals on the national and international competitions. The conservatory of dance it was a dream, the dream came true in 2010. Now I study in national conservatory of dance in Lisbon and I have the opportunity to learn more and more to become a professional dancer. From 2013 I do a extra ballet education in EDAK and in 2014 I was been selected to integrated the master class of contemporary dance in "Move It" at London. 
My live is a dance and I live in constant movement in search of new road to dance. The new road is Jump Dance competition in Chicago and for this I need your support. 
What We Need / The Impact 
I need your support for to be able to fly in this new adventure of dance, I need 4.500 euros. This monetary value is applied in the production of travel and the participation of the competition. The production consists of the following parameters: event participation, private dance lessons, visa letters, travel and accommodation.  I've been selected for this competition, it's real, my dream came a true at the age fourteen. This competition is coordinated by the greatest choreographers in the world as Mia Michaels, Gil Stroming, Mandy Moore. I will be competing for a scholarship to study contemporary dance at a higher that my age category. I was selected among thousands of people around the world. I can not miss this opportunity. This could change my life and I can really became a professional dancer.

story:
What Third Side On The Road Is About

The Third Side is a new dance work I am creating for inclusion in dance Immersion's Queen's Calling Choreographers' Showcase scheduled for February 6-8, 2015 in Toronto. We need your help in making this a success.

I am Artistic Director of A Company of Dancers (ACOD), a federally tax exempt organization based in Detroit, MI. ACOD currently uses 6 dancers although we've had a roster of as many as 12. Our number of dancers depends on the dance pieces being performed. 

Personally, I am a performing artist who works in more than one genre of the arts. I have received grants for creating a number of multidisciplinary works using artwork, music, film projection and, of course, movement. I am an Assistant Professor of Dance and for the last two years been a Master Teacher affiliated with Michigan State University's Michigan Museum's Michigan Traditional Arts Apprenticeship Program. In 2012 I was given the Heritage Award in the Performing Arts. In 2008 I was ArtServe Michigan (now the Creative Many) Arts Educator of the Year.

I created a poster to represent our project. This poster, also, speaks to the unique voice within the piece. Titled from lines written by Stirling Silliphant, the piece explores all kinds of social dance for the stage as elements integral to the development of this contemporary ballet. It is, also, a world premiere filled with emotive call-and-response voicings that looks at the sensibilities of the personalities within it. It is an abstract mélange, which uses social dance steps of the 20th century, ballet and contemporary/modern dance to look at three sides of a coin – the voices of mother, daughter and abductor.

Although based on the abduction of the Nigerian schoolgirls in 2014 the topic has more universal issues within it that can resonate in any community. I feel strongly that the loss of a child, the violation of the sanctity of one's home, domestic terrorism can certainly be found in any community. Predators, theives and gangs live somewhere near you. As the only American choreographer invited to present I feel strongly that coming from Detroit, MI USA allows me to apply an urban outlook.

Our Budget and Investor Perks

I am asking for $3500 to make this dance a reality. Our expenses include -
studio rental for rehearsals 
costumes 
travel to and from Toronto 
accommodations while in Toronto 
per diem for the dancers (food and incidentals while away) 
stipends for the dancers 
a stipend for the choreographer 

We are planning on online showing of the piece. As an investor of at least $5 your name will be added to our credits as a backer. As a $25 investor you will be sent a photograph from the production. As a $50 investor you receive an A Company of Dancers t-shirt. As a $100 investor you receive a signed copy of the original poster I created for this project. (See it below.) Each of these levels also gets the donors name listed in our credits. As a $250 investor you will be listed in our credits as a producer and receive a copy of my swing dance instructional video, Lindy Hop, An Open Class. As a $1000 investor you would be listed as a producer in our credits and receive 4 tickets to the American Lindy Hop Championships, August 21-23, 2015, It is a wonderful weekend of dance, live music and dance performances and classes.

Artspectrum/A Company of Dancers would also give each investor a charitable receipt for your contribution.

If we are not fully funded as always I'll be the last person paid and the last person whose expenses would be covered. My goal is to take care of my dancers and not make working with me or our company or traveling with us a hardship.

The Impact

Your investment

  • allows me to have a voice in a time when so many people need one
  • allows the United States to be represented in the Showcase
  • supports the arts in a country where most politicians want to eliminate arts support

Risks & Challenges

First risks. This dance work has a dancer en pointe, a barefoot dancer and a dancer in athletic shoes. Each of these scenarios is a risk for injury. I do a lot of lifts in my work so falling, twisting muscles, sprained ankles even broken bones are aways a possiblity.

And, our biggest challenges are

  • finding the time and space to rehearse. Studio space is not free. In most cases renting space costs more than what the dancers get paid. 
  • dance Immersion curates dances that grew out of the African diaspora. So weaving Lindy Hop and other vernacular dance styles with concert dance has been a hurdle to my creative juices. 

Though we realize the risks and challenges and will do everything we can to avoid them, taking care of everyone involved.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can always help.
Help us get the word out. Share with your friends and colleagues.
Take a look at Indiegogo's sharing tools
Like our Facebook page and encourage others to do so by going to A Company of Dancers on Facebook

The Third Side poster is available at the $100 level. It comes signed.

dance Immersion curates dances that grew out of the African diaspora. So weaving Lindy Hop and other vernacular dance styles with concert dance has been a hurdle to my creative juices. 


Though we realize the risks and challenges and will do everything we can to avoid them, taking care of everyone involved.   Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute you can always help.Help us get the word out. Share with your friends and colleagues.Take a look at Indiegogo's sharing toolsLike our Facebook page and encourage others to do so by going to A Company of Dancers on Facebook  The Third Side poster is available at the $100 level. It comes signed.

story:
Short Summary

Taking the mick theatre company present Michelle Douglass' (Winner of the Kenneth Branagh award for new drama writing) new play 'Robbies Date', a new adaption of Harold Pinter's 'The Dumb Waiter' and the companies newest piece 'The Mountain Bluebird.' All three pieces will be performed at the Courtyard Theatre, London. 

Robbie's Date

What about in the old days eh? When they used to have public hangings and every bugger across the town would turn up to be entertained by some poor sod snapping their neck. People are bastards

It’s not all like that. People can be good. They can change

You’ll never last son. You’ve not got the balls to do anything

Holed up in their grimy Gateshead flat, Robbie and Carl are trapped in a dingy world of petty criminality and the eerie presence of their dead mother. But since Robbie was accidentally involved in a heroic act he has secretly yearned for change - and a rare date with young mum Gemma could be his big chance. Just as long as his overbearing brother, his junkie neighbour and his murky past don’t engulf them both.

He wants to be good. Really he does. But it's a bloody struggle.

Robbie's Date is written by Michelle Douglass who won the Kenneth Branagh Award in 2014 for her play Blown Apart.

The Dumb Waiter 

Armed with revolvers and a few biscuits, Ben and Gus are waiting in a windowless basement…but who – or what – for?

“You never see a soul, do you? – except the bloke who comes. You ever noticed that? I wonder if the walls are sound-proof. Can’t tell. All you do is wait, eh?” 

Harold Pinter’s acclaimed and sharp one-act play The Dumb Waiter comes to The Courtyard’s intimate studio space this winter. Hilariously entertaining, but darkly threatening and claustrophobic, this endlessly absurd thriller will captivate and bemuse you from start to finish.

Directed by Matthew Bosley. 


The Mountain Bluebird

‘Lads’ running pr campaigns as far right movements begin to stir. 

Josh and Amelia meet online in a world of false promises, inspirational quotes and a million buzzfeed lists. 

“Funny, touching and never overdone- ****” Three Weeks (Journos 2013) 

“They are going to break the big time and do the North East proud” Newcastle Evening Chronicle 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for financial help to help us make the pieces the best they can be. We have exciting ideas for design and more importantly want to make sure our hired creatives get some sort of financial help. 

We do not have and have never had any financial help from any bodies including the arts council. We have managed to do all of our productions on a shoestring with the help of campaigns like this one. It is our sole method of fundraising. 

Perks for donating will include tickets for the shows, a copy of the plays, t shirts, alcohol, kisses, hugs and signed pictures of any animal you desire. Any. 

The Impact

  • Taking the mick strive to create work for up and coming actors, directors and writers. A donation would go a huge way to helping us create jobs in what is an extremely tough industry with very little money for the small people. 
  • The mountain bluebird shows a world that a lot of us are a part of nowadays. It is our job to tell a story and create discussion through the medium of theatre. Robbie's date is very much a story of modern times too, petty crime, poverty and family drive the story.  
  • Where will your money go? Our main concern is to make sure all of the creatives onboard get what they deserve for their time. That doesn't include me (Jamie) it is more to do with our actors, directors and stage managers. Once our guys are paid the plan is to go for a really cool stylised sets, something 'Taking the mick' has never got the chance to do before. 

Risk

It is always a risk to produce theatre when you aren't a huge commercial entity. At taking the mick we rely on donations to keep our ideas alive. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Don't worry if you can't help with a donation, a share of our project or facebook page would go such a long way!

story:
Short Summary

This one-act new play by Lucia Cox completes The WInged Trilogy (Dawn Chorus, Blackbird). It is based on English Folk stories, fairy tales and folk songs. 

It is the story of an adopted daughter (Cuckoo) who is left to nurse a broken-hearted mother to her grave. Once gone, her biological daughters come home to claim their inheritance with dire consequences and disturbing truths about their past.

Told using original folk music, traditional songs and folk dance, the piece will be performed at Salford City Council gem, Ordsall Hall.

There will be a local community choir and we have a partnership with MMU Fashion department with 2nd year students designing and making the costume.

Reaching audiences who do not normally engage with theatre and to offer professional development to young creatives is at the heart of House of Orphans ethos and goal. 

We are committed to making work in the NW but have also toured to London's Cockpit Theatre and to 59E59 in New York (One Hand Clapping, 2015). We hope to take Cuckoo on the road after its premiere in Salford.

For more information about past projects: www.houseoforphans.com


What We Need & What You Get

We have an Arts Council bid in and are waiting for the decision on this but we don't have enough for the project to be realised and that's where we need your help.

We want to run workshops for the local community at the Hall and buy the materials for the costumes so that the students are not out-of-pocket. 

We would also like to pay expenses for students and our community choir which we cannot do without this extra helping hand from you generous folk.

We can't offer free tickets this time around as it's a small venue who needs to make money from the ticket sales but we can keep a list of contributors and offer signed posters by the cast and composer and free tickets for future House of Orphans events.

The Impact

English folk tales and folk music are not exclusive art forms. They originate from ordinary people like you and me telling cautionary tales to one another around firesides. This way of connecting has got lost along the way. We wanted to reconnect this idea with people. Making work for them and with them.
Cuckoo has been two years in the making and is a passion project for me and the contributors. Ordsall Hall are excited by the prospect of housing such a rich, theatrical event along with workshops.
House of Orphans, including Emily Portman, Rebecca Jenner and Michael Betteridge have proven track records within their industries and have delivered tours, events, gigs and productions as far a field as New York and Iceland and closer to home in Salford (a site-specific ghost play in a pub!).
Between us we have delivered over twenty Arts Council funded projects to high acclaim including Manchester Theatre Award winning projects (Rebecca Jenner -Producer, The Gap, Special Theatre Event, 2016) and have been involved in Re:Play (now PUSH) in 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015.
We are passionate about producing high quality work which resonates with young and old alike.

Risks & Challenges

Making theatre is a risky and expensive business and no one goes in to it thinking they'll make a million pounds. It's not the financial gain that keeps us all returning to our love but our way of telling stories, connecting with other humans, reminding ourselves we are one world.
We know doing site-specific shows and working with the community is a tricky business and may cause technical problems and the knowledge that regular commitment from community members may not always be possible. We also know that students may struggle with the brief to make the costumes.
But, with our combined expertise, we have support in the following areas;
  • We have had much experience of working on site-specific projects and have a risk assessment set up to cover any eventuality which we have overcome on past projects.
  • Having worked with community choirs and theatre companies and run several workshops in community centres, we know we may not get 100% attendance for rehearsals and so a large company and core choir will be in place with the opportunity for our community members to drop in when they can. We would hate them to feel like they can't attend if they have missed one rehearsal!
  • With the help of our designer and the tutors at MMU, the students will have support to complete the costumes. They will also be working in teams and will have the support of one another.
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please share this page and tell people about us. We really need the support of the community to make this community piece!

Many thanks

The House of Orphans Team

story: Hello everyone! I had to put $500 but only need $80. I absolutely love French Woods and have visited every year since 2008. This year a group that was set up to visit, fell through and now I have to get myself out to Hancock. I have no money for the $80 bus ticket (I live off of Top Ramen) and would absolutely be heartbroken if I could not visit. Please find it in your heart to contribute even $1. Thank you very much.

story:
I am a member of a dance group and have been practicing for 6 months for a competition. I am 6 years old and the other kids are about the same age.

When I signed up to be in the group, there wasn't any big deal about being able to go to the contest, but things in my family have changed and I need to try and find a way to raise enough to make the trip.  I know this is asking a lot from people who don't know me or know the situation.  But, these other kids and their families have invested time and money to get here and if I don't go, since I am the only boy in the dance routine, they will also lose.

This is a very tough thing, but my pop thought there just might be 50 people out there in the world who would help me get to the contest.  Not how it should be, but it is what is real.  We are trying every way we know, but the situation is tougher than any of us thought.  We decided to NOT put a sob story, but just the truth of the situation and our trust that everything will work out perfectly.

So, I reach out to anyone who reads this and hope some of you can find a place to help a young boy who wants to be able to do what he promised and also not let down the other kids.  I also really want to finish what I started.

I thank you and know this will all work out.

All of the money we raise will be used for the trip only.  Nothing fancy or wasted.  Just travel, room and eating for the contest.  If there is any money left or we raise more than we need, it will be donated to a local group to help homeless kids.

I really don't have any perks I can offer except that I will send you a letter of thanks from me, the 6 year old, personally and let you know how we did.

If you wonder why there are no photos or names, my Mom thought it would be best that way out of respect for everyone and to be safe.

story:
THE THREE SISTERS

by Anton Chekhov
adapted by Sarah Ruhl
directed by Benita de Wit

Russia, 1900. Three sisters (and one brother) are living in the country longing to return to the city. But as time pushes forward, fortune turns to misfortune.


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We're putting up a production of The Three Sisters at Columbia University with a $100 budget (for the entire show)! We would really like to include live music and we have an incredible pianist in the cast…. but no piano. We have found someone who is willing to lend us a beautiful piano, we have found a way to transport the beautiful piano, but we cannot afford to tune the beautiful piano. 

We think that having live music makes enough of a difference to the show that it's worth trying to raise the money to tune the piano. If you help us make this happen we can deliver a much better show and in exchange you get access to a number of great perks, including special access to the artists and the show.  And our undying love and affection.

Show tickets are FREE, so it won't cost you to come along and check out our work, but if you can throw in a few dollars and help us make this happen we can deliver a better show for you!

    Fundraising Goals:
    If we reach $200 we will be able to tune the piano

    If we reach $300 we will be able to purchase some crucial props and costumes and all audience members will receive free refreshments at intermission!

    If we reach $400 we will be able to pay for professional photographs of the show which we will share with you!

    If we reach $500 we will be able to pay for additional lighting equipment and gels and share a celebratory drink with our funders on closing night!


    WHO YOU'RE SUPPORTING

    Our incredible team features the talents of...
    Gabriella Grier.................(Olga)
    Alice Renier....................(Masha)
    Kea Trevett.....................(Irina)
    Nick Shea ......................(Andrei)
    Gabrielle Greer ..............(Natasha)
    Jon Meyer.......................(Tuzenbach)
    Quinn Rol .......................(Vershinin)
    Nate Foster.....................(Kulygin/Ferapont)
    Aaron Morton..................(Chebutykin)
    Jian Carlos Vasquez........(Fedotik)
    Sarai Heria…………………..(Anfisa/Rode)
    Eric Cotti …………………....(Solyony)


    Director - Benita de Wit
    Producer - Emily Comisar
    Stage Manager - Jessi Cotter
    Costume Designer - Adrienne Carlile
    Lighting Designer - Jennifer Hill
    Graphic Design - Yue Liu

story:
The Story

My name is Kris Kontour and I started my own theatre production company, Leftend Productions, to bring enlightenment through comedy.

Twelfth Night is Shakespeare's romantic comedy, but there is more to it than just that. The clever bard wrote a script for the festivities on the twelfth night holiday that is all about rabblerousing. The script definitely embodies the holiday as it has lots of  having fun, gender switching, foolery, and he even slipped in some jokes poking fun at himself. However, his cleverness didn't stop there, he dropped in some ideas about gender and the role gender plays in love as well as some interesting viewpoints on what  love means to each person.  Which is why I chose this play, we get to indulge in the language and the comedy but it also has some points that still pertain to the modern community.

That being said I wanted to stage Twelfth Night in an outdoor urban park or garden setting. As our set designer Kari Warfield says "Shakespeare's outdoors is a place anything can happen. In the comedy where just about everything does happen, filling a black box with as much green as possible is a necessity." That is exactly what this campaign is about, building a park indoors. This garden will host some of the staples of The Globe including three separate entrances, a trapdoor, and our interpretation of a balcony. A wood within a neighborhood nestled somewhere between Wicker Park and Bucktown allows us plenty of opportunity for plots to unravel.

Now I already have the space rented at The Den Theatre in the Wicker Park neighborhood of Chicago. Conveniently named Studio 2B. Now we just need to bring the park into the space. I feel it is really important to bring a full set into the space so that the audience can become fully immersed in the play. With your contributions we can create a place separate from the concrete jungle, a place secluded from the garish light of day, love can blossom, fail, and twist perceptions. Hope can be renewed, grief can be forgotten, and songs can be sung. We have the ground plans now we just need the funding.

What We Need & What You Get

As a small company just getting started in the big theatre world we will not be able yet to pay out of pocket for everything. So, we are reaching out to the community to help us so we can help you. First a big thank you to the Den Theatre for letting us use some existing theater flats to help us lower the budget.

To build this set we will need:

  • Leafy Taffeta fabric to create hedge walls $250

  • Wood framing for patio platform and tree for swing $200

  • Fabric for the tree leaves $70

  • Materials to make Planters (with custom artwork) $80

  • Paint and painting supplies $150

Total: $750

The show must go on even if we do not reach our goal. All funds will go directly to help make as much of this set as possible.


The Impact

While growing up I had a Reader’s Digest book titled “Laughter is the Best Medicine.” This is an idea that I believe in wholeheartedly. In today’s world we a constantly bombarded by struggling economy, war in the middle east, and the everyday stresses of life in a busy world. I strive to give to the community a place where they can let the cares and stresses of the world slip away and lose themselves in the fun and frivolity of comedic entertainment. By helping us we can in turn help the community by hopefully taking some of the stress away. I believe in community and everyone getting together not just for a cause but for a shared experience.

You should take a moment to check out what we did last year with Harry Kurnitz’s “A Shot in the Dark”

http://www.leftendproductions.com/Events.html

 

Risks & Challenges

Shakespeare is a classic and bringing classics back to life is a challenge. Fist we have the language. They spoke like this to each other back then but we have digressed to a much less formal way of speaking. This is a definite challenge to step up to as we have to use the language and make its intention clear to the audience. We are also modernizing a classic there is risk in discrepancies from old to new and things we no longer use like swords. Being a classic it has been done many times over and will people come see something that they have seen before? That means that we cannot just have an average show. With your help here we can bring that bar higher with a great set.

Luckily I have put together an amazing team of people the work on this project with a shared vision. We have a talented cast of twelve eager people ready and willing to take on Shakespeare. Plus a great crew of artists ready to get to work vigilantly on the set. And of course the help of my beautiful partner in life Kari Warfield and her set design, script work, and acting.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough and I understand that not everyone can contribute. You can still help out by sharing. Send this out to all your friends however you can.

Use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

And come see us!

Ticket info email:

leftendproductions@outlook.com

Look for us on:

brownpapertickets.com and goldstar.com

The script definitely embodies the holiday as it has lots of  having fun, gender switching, foolery, and he even slipped in some jokes poking fun at himself. However, his cleverness didn't stop there, he dropped in some ideas about gender and the role gender plays in love as well as some interesting viewpoints on what  love means to each person.  Which is why I chose this play, we get to indulge in the language and the comedy but it also has some points that still pertain to the modern community. 
That being said I wanted to stage Twelfth Night in an outdoor urban park or garden setting. As our set designer Kari Warfield says "Shakespeare's outdoors is a place anything can happen. In the comedy where
just about everything does happen, filling a black box with as much green as
possible is a necessity." That is exactly what this campaign is about, building a park indoors. This garden will host
some of the staples of The Globe including three separate entrances, a
trapdoor, and our interpretation of a balcony. A wood within a neighborhood
nestled somewhere between Wicker Park and Bucktown allows us plenty of
opportunity for plots to unravel.


Now I already have the space rented at The Den Theatre in the Wicker Park neighborhood of Chicago. Conveniently named Studio 2B. Now we just need to bring the park into the
space. I feel it is really important to bring a full set into the space so that
the audience can become fully immersed in the play. With your contributions we
can create a place separate from the concrete jungle, a place secluded from the
garish light of day, love can blossom, fail, and twist perceptions. Hope can be
renewed, grief can be forgotten, and songs can be sung. We have the ground
plans now we just need the funding.

   What We Need & What You Get 

As a small company just getting started in the big theatre
world we will not be able yet to pay out of pocket for everything. So, we are
reaching out to the community to help us so we can help you. First a big thank
you to the Den Theatre for letting us use some existing theater flats to help
us lower the budget. 
To build this set we will need:


Leafy Taffeta fabric to create hedge walls $250


Wood framing for patio platform and tree for
swing $200
Fabric for the tree leaves $70
Materials to make Planters (with custom artwork)
$80 
Paint and painting supplies $150

Total: $750
The show must go on even if we do not reach our goal. All
funds will go directly to help make as much of this set as possible. 

  The Impact


While growing up I had a Reader’s Digest book titled “Laughter
is the Best Medicine.” This is an idea that I believe in wholeheartedly. In
today’s world we a constantly bombarded by struggling economy, war in the
middle east, and the everyday stresses of life in a busy world. I strive to
give to the community a place where they can let the cares and stresses of the
world slip away and lose themselves in the fun and frivolity of comedic entertainment.
By helping us we can in turn help the community by hopefully taking some of the
stress away. I believe in community and everyone getting together not just for
a cause but for a shared experience. 
You should take a moment to check out what we did last year
with Harry Kurnitz’s “A Shot in the Dark”
http://www.leftendproductions.com/Events.html

  
  Risks & Challenges


Shakespeare is a classic and bringing classics back to life
is a challenge. Fist we have the language. They spoke like this to each other
back then but we have digressed to a much less formal way of speaking. This is
a definite challenge to step up to as we have to use the language and make its intention
clear to the audience. We are also modernizing a classic there is risk in discrepancies
from old to new and things we no longer use like swords. Being a classic it has
been done many times over and will people come see something that they have
seen before? That means that we cannot just have an average show. With your
help here we can bring that bar higher with a great set.
Luckily I have put together an amazing team of
people the work on this project with a shared vision. We have a talented cast
of twelve eager people ready and willing to take on Shakespeare. Plus a great
crew of artists ready to get to work vigilantly on the set. And of course the
help of my beautiful partner in life Kari Warfield and her set design, script
work, and acting.   
  Other Ways You Can Help 

Times are tough and I understand that not everyone can
contribute. You can still help out by sharing. Send this out to all your
friends however you can.
Use the Indiegogo sharing tools!
And come see us!
Ticket info email:
leftendproductions@outlook.com


Look for us on:
brownpapertickets.com and goldstar.com

story:
A Few Words About Quantum Dragon Theatre

Hello! Welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for Quantum Dragon Theatre.

What's This About: We believe that science fiction (and fantasy, and post-apocalyptic wastelands, techno-dystopias, steampunk utopias, time travel paradoxes, superheroes, Lovecraftian horror, and everything in between) is awesome. We also believe that live theatre is awesome. Quantum Dragon is about taking these awesome things and merging them together.

Who Are We: We are the San Francisco Bay Area's first and only speculative-fiction-centric theatre company. We love these kinds of stories, but they are almost never to be seen on stage - we exist to solve this problem. Don't expect to see any Shakespeare or Ibsen here: we're focused on original works, rarely performed genre plays, and adaptations of your favorite stories and novels. That's just how we roll. 

Our Promise: We will never let off the gas, rest on our laurels, or dabble in the mundane. Always expect the unexpected. By pushing the boundaries of the theatre and telling these new types of stories, we hope to fascinate, entertain, and maybe (just maybe) learn a little more about what it means to live in this crazy reality of ours.

Why Indiegogo: We've got a great line-up of three plays which we intend to present over the course of 2016. They run the gamut from cerebral to emotional, dystopian to lighthearted, near-realistic to wildly conceptual. They all focus on fascinating characters trying to cope with the worlds in which they live. We're excited to show them to you. 

But to make this season happen, we're going to need your help. 

Our First Season


Welcome to the National Justice Virtual Trial Service. If you are watching me now, you are either “logging on” from home or a Cordan Kreig hospital or medical care center. Many of you who are either in comas or cryogenic stasis may need to be briefed on the current judicial process, and will receive tutorial guidance throughout the trial. We wish to thank you in advance for your participation and patience.

This room is not real. It is a thought-generated construct. The people around you are other jurors such as yourself, also plugged in virtually, also either comatose, cryogenic stasis, or otherwise suffering from some form of disconnected conscious.

Two cases. No right answers. And only ten seconds to make your decision.

Welcome to jury duty.



While the System is being invaded by mindless alien beings, Mayra Ecazin, a brilliant physicist, has discovered the secret to traveling at the speed of light. The race to get the machine made, however, proves more difficult than anticipated. Suddenly, everyone is interested in Mayra and her achievements, but their intentions are perhaps, less genuine. 

While Kantis, a nearby planet and home to Mayra's best friend Valki, fights for survival, Mayra herself struggles for life due to a severe drug addiction that allowed for her great discovery in the first place. 

The clock is ticking, and all involved are working as fast as possible– but is it fast enough?



We at QDT are invested not only in producing existing works of science fiction and fantasy, but also in fostering the creation of new genre plays. We’re going to be doing that through a program we call the Forge.

Over the course of our 2016 Season, we will be working with four already-selected playwrights to develop four wildly different plays. Each play will be matched with a director and cast and will be given two staged readings at various points throughout the year. After each staged reading there will be a talkback so the playwright can gauge audience response. Plays which have been through the Forge will be strongly considered for future QDT seasons. 

Stay tuned over the course of the year for more information about playwrights and plays!



Unlike her best friend Kai, a brilliant spellcaster, Gerda has no aptitude for magic and buries herself in history and lore instead. When a dangerous entity intent on decimating their world unleashes an ancient curse from myth, Kai is infected and vanishes. 

Now, Gerda must use every mundane skill she can muster in a race through their swiftly dying lands to find Kai before the curse destroys his mind...and all hope of breaking the curse is lost with him.


Perks

Rather than doing the same tired t-shirt/coffee mug/bumper sticker trifecta you see on many crowdfunding campaigns, we wanted to do something different. When you contribute to Quantum Dragon, you get a personalized perk, from us to you. No two perks will be alike. What you get depends on the level at which you donate (see right).

Morgan's Howl: Morgan will shout your name, or a short message of your choice, from the hilltops. We'll film it and send you the video file on the off chance you didn't hear it live. The man has impressive pipes. 

Sam's Verse: Sam will write a science-fiction or fantasy limerick, haiku, or, if you're lucky, double-haiku on the topic of your choice. Don't know what a double haiku is? Give at this level and find out.

Alandra's Scrawl: Alandra will write a science-fiction or fantasy (but, let's be honest, more likely horror) flash-fiction story with you as the protagonist! Or someone else, if you'd prefer. That would probably be safer, actually. For the sake of your sanity. 

Miles' Canvass: Miles will sketch you a sci-fi or fantasy vista of your choice, then we'll send you the image file to share with the world or hoard in your own private image stash, as suits your fancy.

You can always opt for a lower-level perk, if you're into that sort of thing. Just let us know in the comment section when you donate.

On top of this, some of the perks mention season or concessions passes. A season pass is good for one free ticket for each show of the season, while a concessions pass is good for one free food or drink item from our Reasonably Priced Concessions Booth for each show. 

Who Are These Guys, Anyway?

From left to right:

Denise Farrar, Marketing Director, photographer extraordinaire, car aficionado, and long-time Batman enthusiast.

Sam Tillis, Artistic Director, insane visionary (or maybe just insane), Bay Area theatre drifter, and unrepentant Trekkie.

Morgan Finley King, Director of Development, Khal Drogo impersonator, Tri-Valley celebrity, and master of cinematography. 

Alandra Hileman, Managing Director, indie theatre mastermind, recovering stage manager, and relentless badass.

Miles Callan, Chief Aesthetics Officer, railroad modeler, industrial designer, and international man of mystery. 

AND INTRODUCING.... 


Annie Tillis, Production Manager, world traveler, socialite, ninja warrior.

A Short Q&A

Q: Why are you asking for so much money?

A: Making theatre is expensive, yo! We need to rent performance and rehearsal spaces, build sets, make costumes, rent lighting and sound equipment, print programs and flyers, and of course pay our immensely talented designers, stage managers, writers, and actors. It adds up quick.

Q: Oh. Makes sense. Can I get that in the form of a chart?

A: No. But you can get it in the form of two charts. Note that these numbers for our first season are projections only, subject to the whims of fate and financial realities.

Q: I want to give you quite a bit of money. Is it tax deductible?

A: You bet it is. We currently have fiscal sponsorship under the umbrella of the wonderful Fractured Atlas (https://www.fracturedatlas.org/). What this means is, for all intents and purposes, we are a non-profit organization. Any donations made through this Indiegogo campaign will be tax-deductible, minus the actual worth of any perks you receive.

Q: What?

A: Per federal law, if you get something of value in return for a donation, that value is deducted from the amount you are considered to have donated. Lucky for you, most of our rewards are labors-of-love from us to you, invaluable in every sense of the word. Don't worry about it; just look at the bottom of every perk for the non-tax deductible amount. 

Q: Why do you need our shipping address? Are you shipping anything?

A: Um, no. Your shipping information ensures that Fractured Atlas receives the donor contact information necessary to issue tax receipts. All of our rewards will be e-mailed to you. (But give us a little time to write/record/draw them!) 

Q: Last thing: Why the name Quantum Dragon?

A: Quantum Dragon. Say it out loud. Quantum. Dragon. Quantumdragon. Feels good, doesn't it? That's why.

One Last Thing...

Share this campaign! We want to spread the word far and wide that we're here and we mean business. Let your friends know about us through Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, smoke signal, telepathy, encoded message, or good ol' word of mouth.

story:
Il 5 Aprile abbiamo concluso la campagna con un positivo 56% di fondi raccolti; ci teniamo a ringraziare tutti i nostri sostenitori, ed anche e soprattutto il pubblico che siamo sicuri animerà il Festival a Luglio.

QuindiQuando e Teatribù vi aspettano a Milano dal 7 al 13 Luglio 2014!

...

Our campaign closed the 5th of April with an encouraging 56% funded, now we are working on the last details of the Festival; looking forward to meet you all in Milan from 7 to 13 July 2014.

THANK YOU from QuindiQuando and Teatribù!

...

OSPITI CONFERMATI (in continuo aggiornamento) LIST OF CONFIRMED GUESTS (updated frequently):

- INBAL LORI from Israel http://thewomanicouldhavebeen.blogspot.it/

- IMPROMADRID from Spain http://www.impromadrid.com/

- THE SCHOOL OF NIGHT from UK http://theschoolofnight.com/

- PATTI STILES from Australia http://pattistiles.com/

ABBIAMO DEI NUOVI AMICI! nei nostri shows figureranno anche / NEW PALS IN OUR GROUP! our shows will feature also:

- IstanbulImpro from Turkey

- Gerald Weber & Simone Schwegler from Switzerland

- Sven Stickling from Germany

- Vid Sodnik from Slovenia

- Marie Hattermann from France

...E TANTI DA ALTRI PAESI IN ARRIVO! AND MANY MORE FROM OTHER COUNTRIES!


(Scroll down for english text)

Chi Siamo?

QuindiQuando presenta il progetto MiiM, pensato e sviluppato grazie alla collaborazione con la realtà milanese d’improvvisazione teatrale Teatribù. QuindiQuando è una noprofit culturale che opera sul territorio milanese da quattro anni per la promozione dell’Arte e della Cultura. La nostra associazione ha prodotto e/o partecipato attivamente alla realizzazione di eventi di spicco nel panorama dell’offerta culturale cittadina; una delle collaborazioni di cui andiamo più fieri è proprio quella con Teatribù. 

         

Qual è il nostro progetto?

QuindiQuando lancia il progetto MiiM come una grande scommessa, una sfida, una provocazione: Milano ha bisogno di improvvisare.

All’interno del progetto MiiM, il primo grande evento è proprio MiiM · · Milano Impro international Festival, nella sua prima edizione dal 7 al 13 luglio 2014. Gli ospiti del festival provengono da 12 differenti nazioni, portando l’eccellenza dell’arte improvvisativa nella nostra città. Il programma del festival mette al centro la contaminazione e l’incontro tra culture: ospiti e spettatori partecipano a workshop studiati per diversi livelli di esperienza e spettacoli ad alto tasso di creatività e divertimento.

La filosofia dell’improvvisazione teatrale è tanto chiara quanto potente: non importa quanto improbabile od astratto sia il risultato finale, l’importante è accogliere gli imprevisti e trasformarli in intuizioni, lampi di genio, azioni ed immaginazioni condivise.

Consci della potenza artistica e d’intrattenimento proprie di quest’Arte, ma soprattutto delle sue enormi potenzialità se sperimentata nell’ambito del sociale, i QuindiQuando si impegnano a proporla a milanesi (e non) come un potente mezzo di espressione che può aiutare a migliorare la comunicazione ed i rapporti tra concittadini o semplici estranei, senza ostacoli di età, genere, cultura, etnia o nazionalità.

Milano è il teatro quotidiano di tradizioni, innovazioni ed ibridazioni culturali in cui vogliamo  mettere in scena un rinnovato spirito di partecipazione e comunione sociale: sul palco così come nella vita di tutti i giorni, l’importante è "dire di sì"; non chiedersi cosa dovrebbe essere, ma cosa potrebbe essere; dire "sì, e poi..." invece di "sì, ma..."

Perché abbiamo bisogno di voi?

Stiamo lavorando a questo progetto da più di otto mesi, con entusiasmo ed energia: per renderlo realtà ora abbiamo bisogno di voi. Crediamo fortemente in questa forma partecipativa che è il crowdfunding, in cui le persone (sostenitori, follower, curiosi...) possono riconoscerne il valore e decidere di supportarlo, diffondendolo o diventandone direttamente parte con un contributo.

Cosa abbiamo pensato per ringraziarvi del vostro aiuto?

Per ringraziarti del tuo contributo abbiamo pensato a delle ricompense molto speciali, anche per il pubblico internazionale: magliette autografate, dedica speciale di un’improvvisazione, esclusivi workshop, pass per il festival, fino ad uno spettacolo direttamente a casa tua. Se sei particolarmente fanatico puoi anche diventare sponsor principale!

Con i fondi che ci aiuterai a raccogliere contiamo di portare a termine le spese dell’intero festival, come ad esempio coprire le spese di affitto del teatro, l’alloggio e il vitto per gli artisti, le spese di organizzazione ed il magnifico lavoro finora fatto dai nostri videomaker, grafici e comunicatori per dare corpo ed anima all'evento... organizzare un festival mette tante risorse ed energie in campo!

Dai un'occhiata alla colonna qui a destra per scoprire tutte le ricompense che abbiamo escogitato.

Non puoi contribuire economicamente? Il tuo impegno può comunque fare la differenza: parla del progetto, diffondilo condividendo questa pagina progetto Indiegogo sui social e parlane a quante più persone possibile; aiutaci a creare rumore sulla nostra proposta culturale.

Ti invitiamo a seguirci su Facebook e Twitter per sapere come andrà avanti questa avventura: pubblicheremo infatti continui aggiornamenti, news ed approfondimenti sul festival ed i suoi protagonisti.

Infine ti consigliamo vivamente di guardare anche la nostra pagina profilo su Flythegap dove potrai trovare altri modi per aiutarci: cerchiamo volontari (accompagnatori degli ospiti, maschere), location, materiali, ufficio stampa...

Siamo convinti che il festival offrirà un’esperienza indimenticabile a chiunque ne diverrà parte, e siamo impazienti di immaginare e creare anche insieme a tutti voi le prossime iniziative del progetto MilanoImpro!

Vorremmo poter ringraziare personalmente ognuno di voi; per ora ci accontentiamo di dirvi un grande GRAZIE!

Vi aspettiamo nella nostra Milano dal 7 al 13 Luglio 2014!

------------------------------------------------

Who are these guys?

QuindiQuando is happy to present the newborn project MiiM, conceived and developed together with the Improv school Teatribù of Milan. QuindiQuando is a non-profit cultural organization dedited since four years to the creation and promotion of artistic and cultural initiatives in Milan. Our group has produced or has taken part to several events in the city, some of which featured amazing collaborations with Teatribù.

What is the project all about?

QuindiQuando presents the MiiM project as a bet, a challenge to our city, a provocation: Milano needs to improvise.

Within the MiiM project we are glad to launch the event MiiM · · Milano Impro International Festival, at its first edition this year, taking place between July 7th and July 13th. The guest line up features artists from 12 different countries, bringing the excellence of the art of Improv in our hometown. The program too is conceived as an intriguing sequence of not-to-be-missed appointments: guests and audience are called in taking part to workshops aimed to different levels of experience, where the encounter between different cultures and the active contamination of practices and approaches are going to be the cornerstones of our Festival. Needless to say, there will be amazing night shows too!

The philosophy of Improv is as clear as powerful: no matter how unlikely or absurdly abstract the final result is going to be, the important thing is to welcome the unexpected and turn it into intuitions, ideas and eventually common actions and visions.

We are deeply aware of the inner revolutionary power that this art brings within, where a fresh and inventive artistic approach could be capable to bring unexpected results if ever applied in the social field as an educational practice. QuindiQuando’s commitment is to enhance this feature by proposing this form of art to the citizenry and people of Milan, presenting it as a versatile communication tool able to improve the relationships among its citizens as well as among strangers, with no limits of age, gender, culture, ethnicity or nationality.

Milano is the stage of everyday traditions, innovations and cultural melting pots where we intend to create a renewed spirit of social communion and partecipation. On a real stage as well as in everyday life the important thing is to ‘’say yes’’, asking yourself what it could be rather than what it should be, saying ‘’yes, and...’’ rather than ‘’yes, but...’’

Why are we looking for your help?

We have been working on this project for more than 8 months, with all our energy and enthusiasm: to make it real now we need your help too.

We strongly believe in the power of collective actions as crowdfunding is, where your supporters and followers as well as passers-by can make the difference by chosing to believe in you project and to support it, with an economical contribution or just by spreading the word.

What will you get for your help?Your contribution will not go unrewarded: we prepared a list of special perks for our supporters, Italian as well as international!

Check them out on the right side of the page: autographed t-shirts as well as exclusive workshops, full access special passes, even a dedicated show at your homeplace. If you are a real fanatic you can become our main sponsor! 

The collected funds will be vital to help us cover the main expenses such as: location rent, meals and accommodation for the artists and help for the expenses we are sustaining while organizing, like the production of graphics and video... The organization of a Festival is a wonderful experience involving many resources and energies!

Take a look at the perks listed here on the right to find out more about your rewards!

What if you can’t donate? No problem, your help can still mean a lot to us! Help us get the word out, we're always looking for more supporters; share this campaign on your social channels and talk about it to as many people as possible. Help us make some noise around our project!

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to always get the latest news about our adventure: we will keep our channels up to date and publish highlights and trivia about the event and its protagonists.

Last but not least: check our Flythegap profile page! We have been chosen as pioneers and the MiiM project will also be featured on this new and groundbreaking platform for project management. On the Flythegap project page you will find other ways to help us, such as scouting for volunteers that will help us during the festival days, locations for other collateral activities, press office help...

We are sure that our initiative will be an unforgettable experience for all of its partecipants and followers; we are looking forward to imagining and creating with you all the next events within the MilanoImpro project! 

It would be amazing to be able to thank all of you one by one; right now we'd love to say a huge THANK YOU! And see you in Milan between 7th and 13th July 2014!
story_txt:
Il 5 Aprile abbiamo concluso la campagna con un positivo 56% di fondi raccolti; ci teniamo a ringraziare tutti i nostri sostenitori, ed anche e soprattutto il pubblico che siamo sicuri animerà il Festival a Luglio.QuindiQuando e Teatribù vi aspettano a Milano dal 7 al 13 Luglio 2014!...Our campaign closed the 5th of April with an encouraging 56% funded, now we are working on the last details of the Festival; looking forward to meet you all in Milan from 7 to 13 July 2014.THANK YOU from QuindiQuando and Teatribù!...OSPITI CONFERMATI (in continuo aggiornamento) LIST OF CONFIRMED GUESTS (updated frequently):- INBAL LORI from Israel http://thewomanicouldhavebeen.blogspot.it/- IMPROMADRID from Spain http://www.impromadrid.com/- THE SCHOOL OF NIGHT from UK http://theschoolofnight.com/- PATTI STILES from Australia http://pattistiles.com/ABBIAMO DEI NUOVI AMICI! nei nostri shows figureranno anche / NEW PALS IN OUR GROUP! our shows will feature also:- IstanbulImpro from Turkey- Gerald Weber & Simone Schwegler from Switzerland- Sven Stickling from Germany- Vid Sodnik from Slovenia- Marie Hattermann from France...E TANTI DA ALTRI PAESI IN ARRIVO! AND MANY MORE FROM OTHER COUNTRIES!
(Scroll
down for english text)

Chi
Siamo?

QuindiQuando
presenta il progetto MiiM, pensato e sviluppato grazie alla
collaborazione con la realtà milanese d’improvvisazione teatrale
Teatribù. QuindiQuando è una noprofit culturale che opera sul
territorio milanese da quattro anni per la promozione dell’Arte e
della Cultura. La nostra associazione ha prodotto e/o partecipato
attivamente alla realizzazione di eventi di spicco nel panorama
dell’offerta culturale cittadina; una delle collaborazioni di cui
andiamo più fieri è proprio quella con Teatribù.          Qual è
il nostro progetto?

QuindiQuando
lancia il progetto MiiM come una grande scommessa, una sfida, una
provocazione: Milano ha bisogno di improvvisare.

All’interno
del progetto MiiM, il primo grande evento è proprio MiiM · · Milano
Impro international Festival, nella sua prima edizione dal 7 al 13 luglio 2014. Gli ospiti del festival provengono da 12 differenti
nazioni, portando l’eccellenza dell’arte improvvisativa nella
nostra città. Il programma del festival mette al centro la
contaminazione e l’incontro tra culture: ospiti e spettatori
partecipano a workshop studiati per diversi livelli di esperienza e
spettacoli ad alto tasso di creatività e divertimento.La
filosofia dell’improvvisazione teatrale è tanto chiara quanto
potente: non importa quanto improbabile od astratto sia il risultato
finale, l’importante è accogliere gli imprevisti e trasformarli in
intuizioni, lampi di genio, azioni ed immaginazioni condivise.

Consci
della potenza artistica e d’intrattenimento proprie di quest’Arte,
ma soprattutto delle sue enormi potenzialità se sperimentata
nell’ambito del sociale, i QuindiQuando si impegnano a proporla a
milanesi (e non) come un potente mezzo di espressione che può
aiutare a migliorare la comunicazione ed i rapporti tra concittadini
o semplici estranei, senza ostacoli di età, genere, cultura, etnia o
nazionalità.

Milano
è il teatro quotidiano di tradizioni, innovazioni ed ibridazioni
culturali in cui vogliamo  mettere in scena un rinnovato spirito
di partecipazione e comunione sociale: sul palco così come nella
vita di tutti i giorni, l’importante è "dire di sì"; non
chiedersi cosa dovrebbe essere, ma cosa potrebbe essere; dire "sì,
e poi..." invece di "sì, ma..."

Perché
abbiamo bisogno di voi?

Stiamo
lavorando a questo progetto da più di otto mesi, con entusiasmo ed
energia: per renderlo realtà ora abbiamo bisogno di voi. Crediamo
fortemente in questa forma partecipativa che è il crowdfunding, in cui
le persone (sostenitori, follower, curiosi...) possono riconoscerne il valore e
decidere di supportarlo, diffondendolo o
diventandone direttamente parte con un contributo.

Cosa
abbiamo pensato per ringraziarvi del vostro aiuto?

Per
ringraziarti del tuo contributo abbiamo pensato a delle ricompense
molto speciali, anche per il pubblico internazionale: magliette
autografate, dedica speciale di un’improvvisazione, esclusivi
workshop, pass per il festival, fino ad uno spettacolo direttamente a
casa tua. Se sei particolarmente fanatico puoi anche diventare
sponsor principale!

Con
i fondi che ci aiuterai a raccogliere contiamo di portare a termine
le spese dell’intero festival, come ad esempio coprire le spese di
affitto del teatro, l’alloggio e il vitto per gli artisti, le spese
di organizzazione ed il magnifico lavoro finora fatto dai nostri
videomaker, grafici e comunicatori per dare corpo ed anima all'evento... organizzare un festival mette tante risorse ed energie in
campo!Dai un'occhiata alla colonna qui a destra per scoprire
tutte le ricompense che abbiamo escogitato.Non
puoi contribuire economicamente? Il tuo impegno può comunque fare la
differenza: parla del progetto, diffondilo condividendo questa pagina
progetto Indiegogo sui social e parlane a quante più persone
possibile; aiutaci a creare rumore sulla nostra proposta culturale.

Ti
invitiamo a seguirci su Facebook e Twitter per
sapere come andrà avanti questa avventura: pubblicheremo infatti
continui aggiornamenti, news ed approfondimenti sul festival ed i
suoi protagonisti.

Infine
ti consigliamo vivamente di guardare anche la nostra pagina profilo
su Flythegap dove potrai trovare altri modi per aiutarci:
cerchiamo volontari (accompagnatori degli ospiti, maschere),
location, materiali, ufficio stampa...

Siamo
convinti che il festival offrirà un’esperienza indimenticabile a
chiunque ne diverrà parte, e siamo impazienti di immaginare e creare
anche insieme a tutti voi le prossime iniziative del progetto
MilanoImpro!

Vorremmo
poter ringraziare personalmente ognuno di voi; per ora ci accontentiamo
di dirvi un grande GRAZIE!

Vi
aspettiamo nella nostra Milano dal 7 al 13 Luglio 2014!------------------------------------------------Who are these guys?QuindiQuando is happy to present the newborn project MiiM, conceived and developed together with the Improv school Teatribù of Milan. QuindiQuando is a non-profit cultural organization dedited since four years to the creation and promotion of artistic and cultural initiatives in Milan. Our group has produced or has taken part to several events in the city, some of which featured amazing collaborations with Teatribù.What is the project all about?QuindiQuando presents the MiiM project as a bet, a challenge to our city, a provocation: Milano needs to improvise.Within the MiiM project we are glad to launch the event MiiM · · Milano Impro International Festival, at its first edition this year, taking place between July 7th and July 13th. The guest line up features artists from 12 different countries, bringing the excellence of the art of Improv in our hometown. The program too is conceived as an intriguing sequence of not-to-be-missed appointments: guests and audience are called in taking part to workshops aimed to different levels of experience, where the encounter between different cultures and the active contamination of practices and approaches are going to be the cornerstones of our Festival. Needless to say, there will be amazing night shows too!The philosophy of Improv is as clear as powerful: no matter how unlikely or absurdly abstract the final result is going to be, the important thing is to welcome the unexpected and turn it into intuitions, ideas and eventually common actions and visions.We are deeply aware of the inner revolutionary power that this art brings within, where a fresh and inventive artistic approach could be capable to bring unexpected results if ever applied in the social field as an educational practice. QuindiQuando’s commitment is to enhance this feature by proposing this form of art to the citizenry and people of Milan, presenting it as a versatile communication tool able to improve the relationships among its citizens as well as among strangers, with no limits of age, gender, culture, ethnicity or nationality.Milano is the stage of everyday traditions, innovations and cultural melting pots where we intend to create a renewed spirit of social communion and partecipation. On a real stage as well as in everyday life the important thing is to ‘’say yes’’, asking yourself what it could be rather than what it should be, saying ‘’yes, and...’’ rather than ‘’yes, but...’’Why are we looking for your help?We have been working on this project for more than 8 months, with all our energy and enthusiasm: to make it real now we need your help too.We strongly believe in the power of collective actions as crowdfunding is, where your supporters and followers as well as passers-by can make the difference by chosing to believe in you project and to support it, with an economical contribution or just by spreading the word.What will you get for your help?Your contribution will not go unrewarded: we prepared a list of special perks for our supporters, Italian as well as international!Check them out on the right side of the page: autographed t-shirts as well as exclusive workshops, full access special passes, even a dedicated show at your homeplace. If you are a real fanatic you can become our main sponsor! The collected funds will be vital to help us cover the main expenses such as: location rent, meals and accommodation for the artists and help for the expenses we are sustaining while organizing, like the production of graphics and video... The organization of a Festival is a wonderful experience involving many resources and energies!Take a look at the perks listed here on the right to find out more about your rewards!What if you can’t donate? No problem, your help can still mean a lot to us! Help us get the word out, we're always looking for more supporters; share this campaign on your social channels and talk about it to as many people as possible. Help us make some noise around our project!Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to always get the latest news about our adventure: we will keep our channels up to date and publish highlights and trivia about the event and its protagonists.Last but not least: check our Flythegap profile page! We have been chosen as pioneers and the MiiM project will also be featured on this new and groundbreaking platform for project management. On the Flythegap project page you will find other ways to help us, such as scouting for volunteers that will help us during the festival days, locations for other collateral activities, press office help...We are sure that our initiative will be an unforgettable experience for all of its partecipants and followers; we are looking forward to imagining and creating with you all the next events within the MilanoImpro project! It would be amazing to be able to thank all of you one by one; right now we'd love to say a huge THANK YOU! And see you in Milan between 7th and 13th July 2014!

story:
Brooke was first introduced into the performing world when she auditioned for her first musical at the age of 5. She found a love for the stage and continued to perform in over 20 musical productions. She started her dance training her freshman year in High School and started choreographing for the local musical productions.

Brooke Miller is currently finishing her 2nd year at UW-Milwaukee. She is currently pursuing her BFA in Dance Performance and Choreography. She has had the privilege to perform in works choreographed by Maria Gillespie, Dani Kuepper, Keely Garfield and Stephen Koplowitz.

“I have the amazing opportunity to travel with my professor and mentor, Maria Gillespie,and with one other student, to Beijing, China to attend the Beijing Dance Festival in July of 2014.

My goal is to raise $1,200 to cover my tuition expenses to attend the festival and to live in the dormitories provided for us.

Any amount of your time or money is greatly appreciated. In return, you will receive a thank you gift to show my gratitude towards your support."
