story:
Welcome to The ASH Project! 

WHAT IS ASH?

 

ASH is a concert dance piece that explores how our young generation wrestles with the emotional and spiritual effects of the Holocaust through the stories of those who lived through it. The ASH Project takes the 2013 concert dance piece and expands upon the striking narrative, the visceral punch of film, and the dense emotional rawness and physical exertion this intimate work entails to create a captivating art film exploring a young generation's reaction to human suffering. ASH chases after one of the most vulnerable human conditions – the question of profound loss – through stress and struggle as it melts to the edges of the spirit.

 

ASH draws upon art, religion, ritual, and stories from the Holocaust and other great human tragedies to abstract the process of human suffering, weaving a story that follows one woman’s struggle to come to terms with the suffering that surrounds her. We walk with her as her world is torn apart, and we enter her mind and heart as she struggles in a post WWII landscape that seems absent of God or purity. Like many great tragedies, there is no resolution, no answer to be had, just a question that continues in perpetuity; the question of what our actions says about who we are as a people.

  

The powerful choreography of ASH leads the dancers through a narrative of dehumanization and redemption, portraying the dichotomies of human and animal, light and dark, presenting body and spirit as both bound and free as they explore a deep visceral struggle in the throes of the poignant musical scores of Arvo Pärt, Chopin, Hauschka, Glenn Gould, and Alva Noto. ASH is a statement on the collective heart and the ache that is born within it. Through reflections of vulnerability, desperation, resilience, bravery, loss, and above all, hope, we bring into focus beauty and truth in the midst of destruction. It is, at its core, the story of humanity, stripped of artifice and raw in its primal emotions.

 

Filming will take place at the Albuquerque Railyard - a haunting, deserted industrial landscape that can provide, better than any set, the perfect backdrop for the spiritual desolation evoked in the piece. In such an environment, film allows us to take ten steps back from the stage, and perceive the dance within a larger, palpably real setting. It allows beams of sunlight and steel, and dust hanging illuminated in the air to come between the viewer and the dancers, heightening the reality of the experiences portrayed, the subtle movements of fingers, facial expressions of vulnerability and hope, the dirt under the fingernails, and the stained skin.

   

The purpose of the ASH Project is to create a 40-minute film from the concert dance piece, incorporating new choreography, dynamic setting, and all that film has to offer to the telling of a story. Our hope is that we can share this art with a young generation of students and artists to show the importance of trying to connect to events like the Holocaust. Bridging the gap and carrying on conversations about events like the Holocaust grows even more important as the events themselves become further away in time. Once the film is finished, we plan to present it in a grand screening in mid to late May, and take our message to dance festivals and the community at large. 

  

ASH was created and directed by University of New Mexico dance student Kevin Clark, and premiered to high acclaim by a corps of UNM student dancers in October, 2013. ASH was subsequently selected to represent UNM in a juried showcase at the American College Dance Festival in March, 2014. Pre-production for the ASH Project has already begun, and filming will take place in early April, 2014. The ASH Project team consists of ten amazing dancers, an exceptionally talented cinematography crew, a dedicated production manager, and all of you! 

 

 

WHY FILM ASH? 

 


Dance connects us in a primal sense, filling the spaces between us; it lives in our bones, it runs in our blood, it emotes the words we cannot say. These reasons alone are enough to drive us to share our work with an audience larger than live performance can reach. Even more, we want to use the medium of film to raise ASH to a level beyond what is artistically possible in stage performance.

 

Film also lets us bring the viewer’s focus to intimate details - the subtle movements of fingers, facial expressions of vulnerability and hope, the dirt under the fingernails, and the stained skin that are simply lost on stage.


Building on the evocative foundation of the choreography itself, we intend to use every device film can offer to make ASH a truly captivating and visceral experience for the viewer. To add further depth, we are developing new choreography - exclusive to the film - that will explore the effects of religion, ritual and nature on the themes of the piece.    

 

Finally, many of these amazing young artists working on ASH hope to make careers in dance or film. In supporting the production of this film, you can help these aspiring professionals to create a concrete illustration of their skill and dedication, which will surely support them in finding future opportunities to give their artistry and hard work to the arts and to their communities.

 

About the creator of ASH

 

My name is Kevin Clark. I am in my final year of the dance program at the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque, NM, and I am the creator and artistic director of the ASH Project. Since my first introduction to dance in high school, I have been dancing, performing, and choreographing for 9 years. The joy and connection to other people I have found through dance has been nothing short of life changing, and it has become my passion and life path to use this expansive art field to contribute to the world however I can.

In 2013, I became consumed and compelled by the stories and experiences of those impacted by the Holocaust, and I began constructing the concept for the concert dance piece that would become ASH. Countless books, videos, historical research, cultural connections, religious investigation, and movement invention have gone into the development of this piece, and over this past year ASH was brought to life with the help of the remarkable student dancers and the world-class dance faculty at UNM.

Earlier this year, my faculty mentor for this project encouraged me to turn ASH into a site-specific film. Originally, our plan was simply to film the piece as it already existed; however, as planning progressed, and more amazing artists joined us, it became clear that the medium of film would allow us to fill in the necessary background - the cultural and political climate, the religious, personal and social implications - that I felt were missing from the original piece.

So here I am, because I believe we've found something special with the ASH Project - something that deserves to be shared - and we need your help to do that.


What We Need & What You Get

           We are asking for pledges to help fund the many ways we can make ASH amazing. Creating a high quality, visually stimulating, and artistically rich film has many important aspects, and each enhance or facilitate the process in their own unique way.

We decided to get personal with our perks and compiled a specialized set unique to this project, like the 30 Second Solo or A Day On Set! Just to give you an idea of where your generosity goes, below is a list of our highest priority requirements to get us where we need to go:

•                Video and Lighting (operation, equipment, and rental)                      

  - $4150

            Light and video is what makes a film a FILM! This area covers the costs of renting lights, lighting equipment, lighting operators, rigging, video, cinematographers, video equipment, editing, sequencing, and operating. 

•                Wardrobe, Costume, and Makeup (design, construction, materials) -  $1100

        Costumes and makeup are essential to creating the right mood and feel of an artistic piece. This area covers the designing of costumes and makeup for the new sections of the piece, cost of materials, construction of those costumes, specialized DirtWorks makeup essential to ASH, and the makeup crew.

•                Music Rights (licensing, publishing, synch rights)                            -  $1000

            The music of ASH is nothing short of breathtaking; from Arvo Pärt to Hauschka to Frederic Chopin, the soundtrack for this film commands as much attention and emotion as the video does. Acquiring the rights and permission to use these pieces comes part and parcel with any film work, and these masterpieces are no exception. 

•                General Needs                                                                                   -  $1500

            This covers everything from dancers fees, first aid equipment, craft services, set equipment, generators, heaters, printing, and any unexpected costs that may arise.

In the event we raise more funds than our goal, our plan and promise to you all is that we reinvest that money back into the project not only to increase the quality of our final product, but to also pay our dancers and crew a little bit more. We truly have world-class dancers and a phenomenal crew. We want to be able to support them in any way possible for being such a big part in the realization of this vision.


The Impact

Every pledge you give, every time you like or share this project on social media, and every person you encourage to help us puts another minute of film together, puts a dancer in riveting clothing, shines a spotlight onto an intimate moment to be shared with the whole world; it secures a light, feeds a camera operator, puts sound into the ears of the viewer, and brings us that much closer to creating the moving, riveting film I know this project can be. We are ever so humbly grateful for all levels of your support.


Other Ways You Can Help

 

So many of you have already helped with your time and emotional support, and if you are unable to assist us with a contribution here, you can still help us by spreading the word. Feel free to share links to this page on your personal Facebook and Twitter accounts. 

Like the official ASH Project page on Facebook at the link below. In the coming days, we’ll be launching a YouTube channel collecting video clips from some of our performances and behind the scenes footage, which we will also link to.
We also love words of encouragement and messages of belief in our cause! We believe we are doing something truly incredible, and we hope you do too! Email ashthefilm@gmail.com for any questions or comments about the project!

felt were missing from the original piece.
So here I am, because I believe we've found something special with the
ASH Project - something that deserves to be shared - and we need your help to
do that.


What We Need & What You Get
        
  We are asking for pledges to help fund the many ways we can make ASH
amazing. Creating a high quality, visually stimulating, and artistically rich
film has many important aspects, and each enhance or facilitate the process in
their own unique way. 
We decided to get personal with our perks and compiled a specialized set unique to this project, like the 30 Second
Solo or A Day On Set! Just to give
you an idea of where your generosity goes, below is a list of our highest
priority requirements to get us where we need to go:
•               
Video and Lighting (operation,
equipment, and rental)                
     
  - $4150
        
   Light and video is what makes a film a FILM! This area covers the
costs of renting lights, lighting equipment, lighting operators, rigging,
video, cinematographers, video equipment, editing, sequencing, and
operating. 
•               
Wardrobe, Costume, and
Makeup (design, construction, materials) -  $1100
      
 Costumes and makeup are essential to creating the right mood and feel of
an artistic piece. This area covers the designing of costumes and makeup
for the new sections of the piece, cost of materials, construction of those
costumes, specialized DirtWorks makeup essential to ASH, and
the makeup crew.
•               
Music Rights (licensing, publishing,
synch rights)                  
         -  $1000
        
   The music of ASH is
nothing short of breathtaking; from Arvo Pärt to Hauschka to Frederic
Chopin, the soundtrack for this film commands as much attention and emotion as
the video does. Acquiring the rights and permission to use these pieces comes
part and parcel with any film work, and these masterpieces are no
exception. 
•               
General Needs      
                     
                     
                     
          -  $1500
        
   This covers everything from dancers fees, first aid equipment,
craft services, set equipment, generators, heaters, printing, and any
unexpected costs that may arise.
In the event we raise more funds than
our goal, our plan and promise to you all is that we reinvest that money back
into the project not only to increase the quality of our final product, but to
also pay our dancers and crew a little bit more. We truly have world-class
dancers and a phenomenal crew. We want to be able to support them in any way
possible for being such a big part in the realization of this vision. 
The
Impact
Every pledge
you give, every time you like or share this project on social media, and every
person you encourage to help us puts another minute of film together, puts a
dancer in riveting clothing, shines a spotlight onto an intimate moment to be
shared with the whole world; it secures a light, feeds a camera operator, puts
sound into the ears of the viewer, and brings us that much closer to creating
the moving, riveting film I know this project can be. We are ever so humbly
grateful for all levels of your support. 
Other
Ways You Can Help
 
So many of you
have already helped with your time and emotional support, and if you are unable
to assist us with a contribution here, you can still help us by spreading the
word. Feel free to share links to this page on your personal Facebook and
Twitter accounts. 

Like the official ASH Project page on Facebook at the link
below. In the coming days, we’ll be launching a YouTube channel collecting
video clips from some of our performances and behind the scenes footage, which
we will also link to.

We also love words of encouragement and messages
of belief in our cause! We believe we are doing something truly
incredible, and we hope you do too! Email ashthefilm@gmail.com for any questions or comments about the project!

story:
Boldly Into the Future of Poi!

If you're reading this, you probably know what poi is, who I am, and how I've been using Playpoi.com for ten years as a platform for sharing my love of poi.

If you've enjoyed what I've contributed to the world of poi and flow arts, this is your opportunity to say thanks, to be part of my best birthday ever, and to help me roll out some poi projects that will be fun for all of us!

It's time to re-build Playpoi.com from the ground up, and to add community resources, this time with the help of a proven experienced programmer!

I'm willing to roll up my sleeves and do my end of the bargain. It will be a whole lot more fun if I feel like you guys are with me!

There are several projects I want to launch in the coming years, such as:

  • A looping-video poi library
  • A poi-community map of the world
  • How-to-teach-poi resources
  • Touring with a feature poi and fire-puppet performance!
  • Producing a series of choreography videos and organizing poi flash-mobs
  • Permaculture Poi Camp
  • And of course producing lots of new videos.

All these visions are more likely to happen if Playpoi.com works well!

I envision Playpoi.com becoming a true hub for the art form. This is about more than just the future of Playpoi.com. It's about the future of poi itself!

And don't worry, it's also about supporting me! There is enlightened self-interest here! In improving the website I also improve my own ability to make a living via teaching workshops, hosting retreats, and promoting the flow products I like.

So if all my free poi videos have made you smile, or helped you with your poi journey, or made your world brighter, now's your time to say thanks and to make sure others keep benefitting from Playpoi!

Where Does the Money Go?

The money goes to Darren Douglas Lee, the expert Drupal programmer (that's him on the right. He's also an artist... but like, a ninja artist!)

We'll re-build Playpoi.com with a responsive theme in the latest version of Drupal, a powerful content-management program.

The remaining budget will go towards the poi-community map of the world, the looping-video-thumbnails, and making it easier for other poi artists to contribute to Playpoi.com.

To give you just an idea of what Darren will be doing, here's an initial breakdown:

  1. Responsive theme using the existing site artwork. (30 hours)
  2. Full audit of the site content and structure. Re-implementation of existing functionality identified as useful. (50 hours)
  3. Transfer of the existing site content identified as useful to a fresh Drupal 7 site. (40 hours)
  4. Drupal 7 site infrastructure setup - user roles and permissions. Database and site files in scheduled backups. Editorial workflow. (20 hours)
  5. Setup Pantheon development. (10 hours)
  6. Onwards into community resources...

Other Goals

Another goal is to have 10,000 people on the Playpoi newsletter. If I can announce fun poi projects, they can happen! And no, Facebook doesn't work so well any more. The newsletter is better!

Yet another goal is to boost traffic to Playpoi.com to an average of 1000 unique visitors per day. For a few years I was dealing with a shoulder injury and website issues, etc. During this time I wasn't producing much content and website traffic went down (along with registration for Playpoi events, eek). Now that I'm producing content again I want to get traffic back up. You can help promote Playpoi simply by visiting the Poiticipation Page. It's a page of mostly easy and free ways to help Playpoi be awesome.

The Impact

Playpoi.com will be much more awesome!

I will commit to making two new videos every week for all of 2014!

I will go boldly into my 40's knowing that I can make a career with my love of poi! :)

I will spend less time wrestling with website problems and more time producing creative content, community resources, fun community projects, and getting out in the real world to have fun with other people... in short: I'll be putting much more of my energy into the People-Being-Happy-Plan!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute money? No problem, you can still very much help!

Sharing this campaign with your friends and the world will help a lot! Indiegogo makes it really easy with their sharing tools and you can copy to lots of different platforms too.

1. Facebook: If you click the "like" button above that's awesome, but making sure you then "share to Facebook" is even better. That means your friends are more likely to see it!

You can also follow us on Facebook and like/share/comment on our updates about the campaign, helping us to spread to word. 

2. Twitter: Hitting the "tweet" button above is quick and easy, and if you add our twitter profile @NickWoolsey or the #futureplaypoi hashtag, we'll be able to see all of your lovely messages of support!

Following us on Twitter would be great too, especially if you could retweet our campaign related tweets! 

3. Youtube and Google+: Sharing the pledge video with your friends will really help us get our message out there, so we'd love it if you could click through to the watch page, and hit a thumbs up, comment on the video, and then share to all the places you're active online, like Facebook and Twitter. 

Same goes if you're one of the cool kids using Google+ ... please support us by clicking the G+ button above and then "sharing" this page, and by sharing the pledge video on Google+ too!

You can subscribe to Playpoi on Youtube here, and follow us on Google+.

4. Blogs, Tumblr, Websites: If you blog or write online we'd REALLY appreciate your support in telling your readers about our campaign! A blog post, article or Tumblr post linking to this page would be amazing.

You can also go to www.playpoi.com/support for several other ideas of how to help me out without spending any money. I really do appreciate it!

And Lastly: The Video that Started it All...

story:
Our Story

What happens when your world is turned inside out? When you don't feel like yourself anymore? When your own family doesn't recognize you? When reality shifts like quicksand under your feet? Suspended Pieces is a compelling story about a young woman's journey into an abyss she never could have imagined.

 

The Impact

City of Peace is a docu-theatre company dedicated to quality issue-based theatre. Suspended Pieces is the company’s first production. Through the medium of theatre, we hope to, shed some light on a sensitive subject that many have to deal with, yet few are willing to talk about. Your contribution will allow us to put forth an honest and dynamic story about mental health. All profits from the play will go to L’Abri en Ville (www.labrienville.org), a non-profit organization in Montréal that provides housing and a stable community for people with mental health issues. Also, your contributions will help our fledgling production company get off to a strong start.

 

What We Need and What You Get

We are hiring an award-winning graphic designer to create our posters and a strong image that will encourage more people to see the show. We will be setting up a Web page with bi-weekly updates to keep those not on IndieGoGo up to date on all the exciting developments. The rest of the funds will offset the Fringe costs, costumes, props and any other expenses we incur in bringing this story to you. If we do not meet our full target, City of Peace, along with local businesses who purchase an ad in our program, will cover the difference.

 

Performances

Club Espagnol (venue 8)

4388 Saint-Laurent Boulevard

Saturday, June 11, at 8 p.m.

Monday, June 13, at 11 p.m.

Tuesday, June 14, at 6 p.m.

Thursday, June 16, at 3 p.m.

Friday, June 17, at 10 p.m.

Sunday, June 19, at 1 p.m.

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT 

Requiem For Black Marie is a full-length play by Sara Farrington with an ensemble of twelve, including a live band and original score (composed and performed by the St. Fortune Theater Collective) all under the direction of Shannon Sindelar. Requiem is premiering at The Incubator Arts Project, June 14th-23rd.

Requiem For Black Marie is a wild and darkly funny imagining of the sexual and creative ins and outs of the Brecht Machine during the Weimar Republic (1919-1933) period in Berlin. The play is Farrington's interpretation of playwright Bertolt Brecht’s collaboration with his many lovers, specifically, Elisabeth Hauptmann and Margarete Steffin, in the few years before the Brecht team fled Germany in 1933. The play rejects the commonly taken position that Brecht villainously stole from his female collaborators, but rather that the women were complicit in giving their work over to him, which led to miserable, lonely and, worst of all, anonymous lives for both women. Farrington's version of this story (which is only sort of historically accurate) is told in seventeen quick and theatrical scenes, inspired by accounts and stories from the real people involved as well as photos and paintings of the era.

This is where your help comes in...

WHY WE NEED YOUR FINANCIAL HELP TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!

Requiem For Black Marie is an ambitious play and requires a basic battery of theatrical resources. Any contribution you can make, large or small, is a tremendous and supportive gesture and goes directly toward supporting...

  • A live-able stipend for our creative artists, including a cast of 12 and design team.
  • Equipment and materials to realize our set, lighting and costume design.
  • Publicity and community outreach.
  • Insurance to cover the actors and equipment.

HOW TO MAKE AN IMPACT

Your financial help will go directly toward a successful premiere of this play as part of the Incubator's NEW PERFORMANCE SERIES. Our current goal is to raise $7,000 by the time we open on June 14th. Please give whatever you can, anything and everything will help us on this journey! 

This a not-for-profit production and is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, so your contribution will be tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Check out all of the perks to see how you can be involved and even get a sneak-peek of the show. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Maybe you saw the workshop of this play back in August 2012 and fell in love? Maybe your a fan of Brecht and are curious about this controversial story? Just because you aren't able to contribute doesn’t mean you can't help us.

  • Get the word out! Make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to make it super easy.
  • Tell people how much you want to see this show premiere and pass this onto your fancy friends with deep pockets!

THE TEAM

Written by SARA FARRINGTON

Directed by SHANNON SINDELAR

Design by CECILIA DURBIN

Featuring: CALEB HAMMOND, MEGAN EMERY GAFFNEY, ERIN MALLON, JOCELYN KURITSKY, WILL PETRE, GAMZE CEYLAN, TATIANA GOMBERG, JOHNNY GASPER, GAVIN PRICE, YUKI KAWAHISA, NATALIE MACK. 

Curated & Supported by the Incubator Arts Project

story:
Short Summary

Oliva Contemporary Dance Project (OCDP) is a synergism of passion, audacity and perserverance. Initially founded in Italy under the name “Pantaeri,” OCDP has since evolved from 2004 to be known for its exquisite movement style and visionary choreography. With each dancer’s diverse background, individual dancers contribute to the company’s talent as a whole while still manifesting personal artistry. Michele Oliva and Francesca Dario create choreography that magnifies dancers in their prime and provides room for genuine personality to come alive on stage. The company’s trademark style integrates love, strength, and refinement on one stage; this ensures an long-lasting impression with each performance. Itaiian Artistic Director and Co-Founder's Oliva and Dario are at the helm of this global and ambitious company.

We are creating our first USA full length evening of dance and need your support to accomplish this. We are grateful for any amount you can contribute to help us reach our dream of creating our vision and sharing it in the USA.

What We Need & What You Get

We are attempting to raise $15,000 to fund the creation of this OCDP full length evening of dance. Our company consist of 5 dancers plus the Artistic Director/Choreographer.

Our Basic Budget is:

•  Rehearsal Space: $2,000 (1 month of rehearsals, 5 hours a day/ 6 days a week)

•  Dancers Fee: $7,000

•  Theatre Space: $2,000

•  Costumes: $1,000

•  Lighting: $1,500 

•  Insurance and PR: $1,500

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still create the evening using whatever funds we raise and try to fundraise with other platforms as well as teach master classes in the surrounding communities to make our dream come true.

The Impact

After producing numerous projects across Europe, OCDP has moved to New York City to challenge themselves as they strive to develop international recognition. Here they aim to expand their artistic reach and share the same passion that ignites OCDP’s dancers with audiences across the world. By these means, OCDP’s singular mission connects and touches everyone they come in contact with.

Help Spread the Word

Money isn’t the only thing that makes dance thrive, and there are plenty of ways to help our vision come to fruition! 

•  Help make this campaign viral using the Indiegogo share tools to share our Fundraising Campaign with your followers! Our art is by no means limited to our zip code or country, OCDP was formed with the intent of sharing contemporary dance with the world.

•  If you know someone who would be thrilled to support the OCDP vision, please send them this link, put them in touch with us or invite them to the performance.

•  Keep sharing the enthusiasm of OCDP… 

From all of us here at OCDP, we humbly thank you for your support. Welcome to our family! 

MILLE GRAZIE!

story:
Any Stage Theater Company 

We are a group of passionate young artists, ranging in age from 18 to mid 20s. We want to develop and perform a version of Shakespeare, and a version of theater, that is rarely seen in the DC metro area. We want to start with two performances of an abridged production of Hamlet in a modern setting.  Our version will be about 90 minutes. Our basic concept is simple and rooted in the text: Everyone in the play needs psychiatric help, yet no one is getting the right treatment. 

What We Need/Our Goal

We're raising money to reserve performance space and get sets, costumes, wigs, props, and technical aspects. We plan to perform, outside, in April or May of 2015 in Reston, Virginia.

    The Impact

    Help a bunch of creative people bring Shakespeare to a new audience. 

      Risks & Challenges

      Our biggest obstacle: securing a space. We have many venues in mind, but they all cost several hundred dollars. If enough money is donated, this problem should be solved rather easily. We also realize that we will need to aggressively promote our show, since Shakespeare doesn't automatically attract people the way it could. Weather could also pose a risk, but almost all of the places that we're looking at are pavilions and/or have coverings. As a result, the play could be performed rain or shine.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Visit and share our website http://anystagetheater.blogspot.com/

story:
We're screwed!

Our rehearsals have gone great. We've got an AMAZING cast, and an exceptional play written by one of the greatest playwrights of all time; Tennessee Williams.

But..

We have had a sponsor pull out last minute because of their own cash flow issues and we desperately need the money to get the show up to Edinburgh (our last instalment of venue fees & the remainder of our accommodation fees).

Can you you help us? No donation is too small.

Seriously. Every penny counts.

Update: While we've met our original goal we need more help.  We've got our accommodation paid now, but we're really tight on venue fees and have nothing left over for flyers.

What is Confessional?

Confessional is like getting to sit in an episode of Eastenders, except it’s the best episode ever, as it was written by Tennessee Williams.

Confessional is a one-act play set in a seaside bar which Tennessee wrote towards the end of his career. It's a superbly-written play about a group of wonderful, broken characters over the course of a single evening.  We're restaging Confessional in a modern British seaside pub (think Blackpool or Southend) and the play will be semi-immersive, so the audience can sit and drink while the action unfolds around them.

"Out of brokenness shines unexpected beauty"

Why do we need the money?

Jack Silver, director:

"Unfortunately, we've had a sponsor pull out at the last minute, giving us a cash flow crisis. The timing obviously couldn't be worse.

"We have a deadline to pay our remaining venue fees and accommodation fees by 1st August. If we can't make these payments, we can't go.

"The frustrating thing is that ticket sales are going very well, we've got guaranteed coverage in The Stage, the Daily Telegraph,  and several other Edinburgh Fringe publications, and the performances in the play really are world class. 

"I honestly believe that there are some career-launching performances in Confessional, I know that audiences will love the play and it would be really, really sad for all the hard work this incredibly talented and generous group of actors has put in to go to waste.

"Confessional is not a well-known play, but I think it's actually a brilliant play, which tackles timeless themes such as love, loss, betrayal, and loneliness, with a brilliant religious undertone. It deserves to be seen by a wider audience. We think this would be the UK premier of Confessional."

Who you're helping

The cast of Confessional by Tennessee Williams is:

  • Lizzie Stanton as Leona Dawson
  • Ray Bethley as Monk
  • Joshua Leese as Bill McCorkle
  • Simone Somers-Yeates as Violet
  • Jackie Lam  and Chris Mills sharing the role of Steve
  • Abi McLoughlin as Doc
  • Tommy Rowlands as the Young Man
  • Ben Moos-Golding as the Boy

Here's the blurb from the fringe programme..

"Share a drink with a group of shameless lowlifes and watch their lives implode. This innovative, immersive production reimagines Tennessee Williams's play in a British seaside bar, frequented by life's flotsam and jetsam. Join the regulars over the course of a furious and fun evening, as a pair of strangers enters their world and all hell breaks loose. 

"Written in 1970, Confessional features Williams's first openly gay character and arguably his most sympathetic female character: needy beautician, Leona."

Other Ways You Can Help

No donation is too small.

But if you can't give money, you can still help. Please spread the word.

Please be shameless on our account. Please ask your friends, family, work colleagues, and random strangers in the pub to chip in even the smallest amount.

We've got got everything crossed.

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

Miscreant Theatre Collective 2020 Season

 

Introducting Our First Season!

     Macbeth: A Very Serious Play by William Shakespeare – January / February 2020

     Pillowman by Martin Mcdonagh – May 2020

     Celtic Yule: An Ancient Celebration of the Winter Solstice – November / December 2020

 

We, the Miscreants of Denver, are seeking to produce high-quality, accessible and intimate fringe theatre! Welcome to our very first season announcement and our very first foray into crowdfunding! Our collective is young but we are not new to the theatre scene;  between all of our unique perspectives we have decades of experience working with and creating live theatre in Colorado, and we think we’ve got some fantastic stories that we want to share with everyone, and that includes folks who don’t normally go to the theatre.

Our 2020 season will have three shows and to hit that super ambitious goal we are going to need everyone’s help. Yeah, that’s right, even you! We have several tiers to suit your budget and if you can’t throw us a few dollars please take a moment to share this campaign on your social media of choice and give us a like on Facebook and Instagram, especially if you’re like Aerosmith and you don’t want to miss a thing.

So, why should you give us some of your hard earned money? Why not use that money for classy brunches, or fidget spinners or whatever you kids are buying these days? Well, with your money you are supporting art and local artists. By donating you become a patron of the freaking arts just like Lord Chamberlain back in the Shakespeare days. And if that isn’t enough for you then peep the perks!

The Impact

Our goal is to create cutting edge, high quality, intimate and accessible theatre that speaks to the hearts and minds of everyone, including those who don't usually go to the theatre. Your donations will go a long way toward making our community a reality!

Our theatre-style is human focused because we believe very strongly in the human element, be that an onstage performer, a director, or a designer. We are dedicated to paying performers and technicians what they're worth. Because you can do great theatre on a shoestring budget if you have the perfect crew of people. So, most of the money you donate will go to the artists that make these shows possible!

Our History

The Collective spun out of the idea of doing Shakespeare's MacBeth. I mean, what could possibly go wrong? And in the process of bringing the show to life an incredible, Power Ranger-like team assembled and we all liked hanging out so much that we decided to form a Megazord of Fringe theatre might! We are now Miscreant Theatre Collective, an ever-growing group of likeminded artists!

Meet the Miscreants!

Erin Slimak (Executive Deviant / Sound Savant / Macbeth DIrector) - A word traveller, Erin Slimak aka Edith Smith, aka E Slim (her hip hop name), returned to the states from Costa Rica where, during an Ayahuasca ceremony. and instead of encountering fifth dimensional beings had a vision of the king of Scottland eating a PBJ, cuddling up to a teddy bear and we all agreed that this had to come to life! Super powers include: sensitivity to and the manipulation of sound waves from extensive meditation, directness, and a mastery of Shakespeare's Folio, and gardener extraordinaire!

Logan Foy (Executive Ne’er Do Well / Lighting/ Tech Overlord / Macbeth Set and Lighting Designer / Pillowman director) - The stage is about to get lit when Mr. Foy is a part of the crew. Nearly killed when he was struck by lightning while hanging lights for an all-cat production of Hedda Gabler he became dependent on draining the essence of light bulbs to sustain himself. He now has the power to listen to lighting instruments and feel the vibrations of the light force. His dad voice is also super legit!

Megan Phelan (Executive Rapscallion / Master Quillsmith / MacBeth Stage Manager) - With the patience of a British nanny and the strength of a North American Grizzly bear, Megan is here to help! Not only is she a brilliant screen and playwright but she also has the ability make sure the rest of the Miscreants don't kill each other but she can also remove any lid from any pickle jar without breaking a sweat!

Andy Rodgers (Executive Swashbuckler / Movement Master / MacBeth Fight Choreographer) - He likes swords and axes and gory, visceral fights... as long as their done safely! He trained in stage combat with a troupe of wise old monks in the distant land of Nanda Parbat only to return with hidden wisdom and a bitchin' beard. Though his greatest superpower may be playing rolls of confused and / or ambiguous sexual identity.

Thomas Gerlick (Executive Scalawag / Community Theatre Malcontent / Misc) - Before he was found by the Collective Thomas was lost in a sea of beer cans and pizza boxes. He was unemployed, his life was in shambles. But now, with the powers of ticketing software, a Square reader and Google analytics research he is ready to help pack the houses and he swears that he's going to learn all his lines by next rehearsal!

 Jordan Hull (Master of the House / Wig Magician / MacBeth Costume designer) - You may see this lovely human when you come to our show selling you a ticket or offering up a tasty beverage. Or you may find her frantically perusing the aisles of a thrift store seeking bargains as a pirate seeks booty! Not only is she a fabulous performer and a Murder Mystery Party must-have but she also just happens to be the betrothed of one Logan Foy who proposed to her at Micreant Theatre Collective's first fundraiser. Also, remember she's got kids and she needs to get PAID! So donate please!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far you are already helping out more than you know. A donation of any amount helps but even if you can't donate right now please be sure to link to our campaign on all of your social medias and be sure to follow Miscreant Theatre Collective on Facebook and Instagram.

Thomas Gerlick (Executive Scalawag / Community Theatre Malcontent / Misc) - Before he was found by the Collective Thomas was lost in a sea of beer cans and pizza boxes. He was unemployed, his life was in shambles. But now, with the powers of ticketing software, a Square reader and Google analytics research he is ready to help pack the houses and he swears that he's going to learn all his lines by next rehearsal!
 Jordan Hull (Master of the House / Wig Magician / MacBeth Costume designer) - You may see this lovely human when you come to our show selling you a ticket or offering up a tasty beverage. Or you may find her frantically perusing the aisles of a thrift store seeking bargains as a pirate seeks booty! Not only is she a fabulous performer and a Murder Mystery Party must-have but she also just happens to be the betrothed of one Logan Foy who proposed to her at Micreant Theatre Collective's first fundraiser. Also, remember she's got kids and she needs to get PAID! So donate please!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
With a Little Help!

My name is Jack Zullo.  I'm an actor writer and comedian and ever since I was a little boy, I've been fascinated by the late great Saturday Night Live legend John Belushi.  From as long as I can remember, I've felt a kinship with him, a connection and most importantly, inspiration.

My show "Live From the Grave...It's John Belushi!" received nominations for Best Cabaret, Most Unleashed Performance (Jack Zullo), and won the Producer's award at The 2016 Hollywood Fringe Festival.  This December, I'm revamping the show, changing the title and debuting it in New York City for the first time.   And, I couldn't be more excited about that, especially given the support we've received from John's inner circle of close friends, colleagues and family. 

 

"I really liked what you did. You really captured the spirit of the time. I was there for that...I loved how aggressive you made John on stage." - Jim Belushi, John's brother

 

A Tale of Two Campaigns

This campaign is about two things.  One is the production costs of the NY run at Theatre 80.  That includes things like theatre rental, advertising, social media, the band, actors, etc.  The other is the cost of the documentary about the making of this show.  I am blessed to be very heavily involved in one of the most genuine and supportive filmmaking cooperatives in Hollywood.   

We Make Movies

We Make Movies boasts the first functional format for a member-funded, owned, and  run film and television collective. Founded in 2009 in Los Angeles, WMM provides free workshops, discounted resources and services, educational industry events, and fosters an inclusive community of over 5,000 independent filmmakers, writers, and actors. We Make Movies empowers creative professionals who are developing and producing original works, and is also available for hire as an independent production company.  We Make Movies

For TWO Charity Benefits

In addition, because John, like many brilliant comedic artists, was troubled and died way too early from drugs, we're making the entire three week New York run a benefit for two established entertainment charities. 

Gilda's Club

Gilda's Club  New York City (GCNYC) was founded in memory of the talented Saturday Night Live comedian, Gilda Radner, who said that having cancer gave her membership in an elite club she rather not belong to. Founded by Gene Wilder (Gilda’s then husband), psychotherapist Joanna Bull, Mandy Patinkin, Joel Siegel, and other friends and generous individuals, GCNYC opened its iconic Red Door in 1995 to provide a place where cancer patients and their families could find support, resources, and a community that cares.  It's obvious, the love Gilda had for John was not only ever present, but eternal.  And anything eternal has the one thing the universe can't fight: Hope

  

 

The Comedian's Assistance Fund

Motion Picture Television Fund and The Comedy Store have partnered up to create The Comedians Assistance Fund to provide a safety net of services to comedians with roots at The Comedy Store.  The Comedy Store, led by chief executive officer Peter Shore, will be providing funding under a two-year grant and, in turn, MPTF will be supporting the initiative with a full-time social worker dedicated to the comedian community. Services will include emergency financial assistance, counseling and referrals, health care and insurance guidance, senior care, and more. Whenever John was in LA, he'd stop by The Comedy Store, often getting up on stage, sometimes with Robin Williams, and belting out just a sample of the best blues harp and comedy this side of a Chicago cheeseborgah.  We are honored that  The Comedians Assistance Fund has honored our production by accepting a percentage of the door of the entire NYC run of With a Little Help...It's John Belushi.

Production Costs

The production costs of this project breakdown into two parts.  The run of the theatre show and the cost of the documentary.

The Theatre Run

Theatre 80 is a long established theatre in the Lower East Side of Manhattan.  During Prohibition, 80 Saint Marks Place was a mecca for performers of all kinds. Jazz greats such as Thelonious Monk, Harry “Sweets” Edison, John Coltrane and Frank Sinatra performed there when the space was a nightclub

Theatre 80 has graciously given With a Little Help a 3 week run from December 1 thru December 23, 2019, this year.  We looked at a lot of theatres in New York City and none by far comes close the magical cross-stream of history, prominence, location (East Village where John thrived) and affordability. 

So, keeping in mind that there are two parts to this creative project, first is the cost of renting the theatre, hiring all the people to make it happen, publicize it to get press and sell tickets, etc., etc., when does it ever end! (LOL)  So, take a deep breath grab my hand, and let me take you behind the scenes and show you just what it takes to do anything of quality. 

Theatre Production Cost Totals: $143,600

Including:

  • Theatre rental: $32,800
  • Actor’s Fees: $13,000 (including two Los Angeles previews)
  • Musicians: $8,750 (Crazy Tomes Foursome)
  • Actor Housing: $8,000
  • To see the complete budget, find our spread sheet by clicking here. 

​

The Documentary Production Cost Total Including all Post Production: $27,400

Eric Michael Kochmer is We Make Movies's Head of Production and a seasoned filmmaker with 5 feature films under his belt.  Eric is producing/directing the documentary of behind-the-scenes production, which will include some of the live theatre run in New York. Eric is super clean on expenses and can bring the doc in on time for a strikingly low cost including all post production.  

Total Production Cost of the Theatre Run and the Documentary: $171,000

 

 "Comedy nerds... and all audiences will enjoy this show. Zullo can bottle his sweat and sell it after every show. A lot of hard work behind the scenes and on stage is apparent." - Bill Chott, Actor

 

Perks

Because we know investors on this particular type of project are gonna be comedy fans who understand that comedy is all about crazy risk and unbelievable reward, we came up with some very unique and really cool perks when you invest in our project.  

Because at the end of the day, it isn't about money or success, it's about comedy and loving life in a huge way, just like John Belushi did; and that's why he stays in our hearts. 

We fully expect to reach our goal, but even if we don't, every single penny will be placed strategically in just the right place to make sure you get the most Belushi bang for your buck.  The production is going ahead; that's a given.  Making this a documentary film in addition to the run of live shows, will make it extra extra special, but will also memorialize the incredible creative experience that we all can proudly say we took part of. 

 

"...final vision that I can sense is lurking just behind the chaos that was swarming around me during the performance I saw...perhaps this is the perfect production about John Belushi one could ever make." - Erik Blair, Writer/Director

 

The Impact

In a world gone mad, it's important to remember the true comedy greats, whose lasting impact lives within each and everyone of us post WWII babies.  John Belushi lived life on his terms, calling the shots and moving at a breakneck speed.  That's how he lived; that's how he performed; and what was ultimately lost in the tragedy of his death was the story of his life.

Risks & Challenges

With tickets for the NY run of the show already on sale and selling, and the production of the documentary already rolling, we are nothing less than a freight train picking up speed as it heads down the tracks.  Are there risks the show won't happen?  I mean who knows.  But right now, it all seems like a go.  A green light as they say in Hollywood.  

The challenges are all about getting the word out and getting people to the theatre to see the show.  But what we have going in?  Is that the show was already a critical and audience success at The Hollywood Fringe Festival.  We not only see no problem transferring that success to this year and in New York City, we see it as an easy fit, especially given that the show and theatre are basically ground zero for John Belushi's creative and party life in New York City. 

 

Putting on a great tribute to one of the 20th Century's greatest comic geniuses and helping TWO great charities.  That's what this campaign is about.  Thank you for checking us out and for any questions you may have, please check out our FAQ section below.  As John would say: "Parrr-TEE!"

Your help in this campaign will make sure all the above happens in a professional and timely manner.  We've got great perks for any level investor and whether you can donate or not, I thank you for your time, your love of comedy and let's all raise a glass to the late great John Belushi.  

For more information, please go to our website and thank you for visiting and donating and/or passing along this campaign to others who may want to donate as well.  

Thank you from the bottom of our comedy hearts, 

The With a Little Help...It's John Belushi! Team

With a Little Help website

 

For Press Inquires:

 A Tale of Two CampaignsThis campaign is about two things.  One is the production costs of the NY run at Theatre 80.  That includes things like theatre rental, advertising, social media, the band, actors, etc.  The other is the cost of the documentary about the making of this show.  I am blessed to be very heavily involved in one of the most genuine and supportive filmmaking cooperatives in Hollywood.   We Make MoviesWe Make Movies boasts the first functional format for a member-funded, owned, and  run film and television collective. Founded in 2009 in Los Angeles, WMM provides free workshops, discounted resources and services, educational industry events, and fosters an inclusive community of over 5,000 independent filmmakers, writers, and actors. We Make Movies empowers creative professionals who are developing and producing original works, and is also available for hire as an independent production company.  We Make MoviesFor TWO Charity BenefitsIn addition, because John, like many brilliant comedic artists, was troubled and died way too early from drugs, we're making the entire three week New York run a benefit for two established entertainment charities. Gilda's ClubGilda's Club  New York City (GCNYC) was founded in memory of the talented Saturday Night Live comedian, Gilda Radner, who said that having cancer gave her membership in an elite club she rather not belong to. Founded by Gene Wilder (Gilda’s then husband), psychotherapist Joanna Bull, Mandy Patinkin, Joel Siegel, and other friends and generous individuals, GCNYC opened its iconic Red Door in 1995 to provide a place where cancer patients and their families could find support, resources, and a community that cares.  It's obvious, the love Gilda had for John was not only ever present, but eternal.  And anything eternal has the one thing the universe can't fight: Hope   The Comedian's Assistance FundMotion Picture Television Fund and The Comedy Store have partnered up to create The Comedians Assistance Fund to provide a safety net of services to comedians with roots at The Comedy Store.  The Comedy Store, led by chief executive officer Peter Shore, will be providing funding under a two-year grant and, in turn, MPTF will be supporting the initiative with a full-time social worker dedicated to the comedian community. Services will include emergency financial assistance, counseling and referrals, health care and insurance guidance, senior care, and more. Whenever John was in LA, he'd stop by The Comedy Store, often getting up on stage, sometimes with Robin Williams, and belting out just a sample of the best blues harp and comedy this side of a Chicago cheeseborgah.  We are honored that  The Comedians Assistance Fund has honored our production by accepting a percentage of the door of the entire NYC run of With a Little Help...It's John Belushi.Production CostsThe production costs of this project breakdown into two parts.  The run of the theatre show and the cost of the documentary.The Theatre RunTheatre 80 is a long established theatre in the Lower East Side of Manhattan.  During Prohibition, 80 Saint Marks Place was a mecca for performers of all kinds. Jazz greats such as Thelonious Monk, Harry “Sweets” Edison, John Coltrane and Frank Sinatra performed there when the space was a nightclubTheatre 80 has graciously given With a Little Help a 3 week run from December 1 thru December 23, 2019, this year.  We looked at a lot of theatres in New York City and none by far comes close the magical cross-stream of history, prominence, location (East Village where John thrived) and affordability. So, keeping in mind that there are two parts to this creative project, first is the cost of renting the theatre, hiring all the people to make it happen, publicize it to get press and sell tickets, etc., etc., when does it ever end! (LOL)  So, take a deep breath grab my hand, and let me take you behind the scenes and show you just what it takes to do anything of quality. Theatre Production Cost Totals: $143,600Including:

Theatre rental: $32,800

Actor’s Fees: $13,000 (including two Los Angeles previews)

Musicians: $8,750 (Crazy Tomes Foursome)

Actor Housing: $8,000
To see the complete budget, find our spread sheet by clicking here. 
​The Documentary Production Cost Total Including all Post Production: $27,400Eric Michael Kochmer is We Make Movies's Head of Production and a seasoned filmmaker with 5 feature films under his belt.  Eric is producing/directing the documentary of behind-the-scenes production, which will include some of the live theatre run in New York. Eric is super clean on expenses and can bring the doc in on time for a strikingly low cost including all post production.  Total Production Cost of the Theatre Run and the Documentary: $171,000 
 "Comedy nerds... and all audiences will enjoy this show. Zullo can bottle his sweat and sell it after every show. A lot of hard work behind the scenes and on stage is apparent." - Bill Chott, Actor
 PerksBecause we know investors on this particular type of project are gonna be comedy fans who understand that comedy is all about crazy risk and unbelievable reward, we came up with some very unique and really cool perks when you invest in our project.  Because at the end of the day, it isn't about money or success, it's about comedy and loving life in a huge way, just like John Belushi did; and that's why he stays in our hearts. We fully expect to reach our goal, but even if we don't, every single penny will be placed strategically in just the right place to make sure you get the most Belushi bang for your buck.  The production is going ahead; that's a given.  Making this a documentary film in addition to the run of live shows, will make it extra extra special, but will also memorialize the incredible creative experience that we all can proudly say we took part of.  
"...final vision that I can sense is lurking just behind the chaos that was swarming around me during the performance I saw...perhaps this is the perfect production about John Belushi one could ever make." - Erik Blair, Writer/Director
 The ImpactIn a world gone mad, it's important to remember the true comedy greats, whose lasting impact lives within each and everyone of us post WWII babies.  John Belushi lived life on his terms, calling the shots and moving at a breakneck speed.  That's how he lived; that's how he performed; and what was ultimately lost in the tragedy of his death was the story of his life.Risks & ChallengesWith tickets for the NY run of the show already on sale and selling, and the production of the documentary already rolling, we are nothing less than a freight train picking up speed as it heads down the tracks.  Are there risks the show won't happen?  I mean who knows.  But right now, it all seems like a go.  A green light as they say in Hollywood.  The challenges are all about getting the word out and getting people to the theatre to see the show.  But what we have going in?  Is that the show was already a critical and audience success at The Hollywood Fringe Festival.  We not only see no problem transferring that success to this year and in New York City, we see it as an easy fit, especially given that the show and theatre are basically ground zero for John Belushi's creative and party life in New York City.  Putting on a great tribute to one of the 20th Century's greatest comic geniuses and helping TWO great charities.  That's what this campaign is about.  Thank you for checking us out and for any questions you may have, please check out our FAQ section below.  As John would say: "Parrr-TEE!"Your help in this campaign will make sure all the above happens in a professional and timely manner.  We've got great perks for any level investor and whether you can donate or not, I thank you for your time, your love of comedy and let's all raise a glass to the late great John Belushi.  For more information, please go to our website and thank you for visiting and donating and/or passing along this campaign to others who may want to donate as well.  Thank you from the bottom of our comedy hearts, The With a Little Help...It's John Belushi! TeamWith a Little Help website For Press Inquires:

story:
Who we are, Why we are

HEIDCO is an NYC-based, interdisciplinary dance company seeking to foster relationships between the arts and other sectors through collaboration, risk-taking and engaging our evolving audiences in new ways. We're questioning what's happening now, in the name of creation, in the name of safety, in the name of community and the proliferation of it. We are aiming to position ourselves as partners in the creative community, rather than agents of displacement. Our point of view directly regards community impact, seeking relevance and constituency amongst disparate audiences and neighbors.

HEIDCO creates embodied responses to wavering examples of democracy present in our society. Our process questions, empowers, and reimagines  organizational systems for the sake of research and development. HEIDCO houses an inclusive environment where collaborators are forced to confront and reshape the conventional methods of creation by distributing and exchanging the roles of leader, supporter, follower and rebel, establishing equality and mutual respect amongst the group. In her essay, (1970) "The Tyranny of Structurelessness," Jo Freeman identifies how power can be distributed in the formation of informal structures. These principles - delegation, responsibility, distribution, rotation, allocation, diffusion of information, and equal access to resources - respond to her involvement in the Women's Liberation Group, and have manifested innately at the core of our process. The work explores movement, theater, bodily puzzles and invites a constant flow of in-studio conversation. Through verbal, nonverbal and unnamable language, the artists process and provide lenses into their realities while in dialogue, collision and agreement with shared space and time.

HEIDstory

Artistic Director and Choreographer, Caitlin Adams launched HEIDCO after re-locating her artistic career from Los Angeles where she made work as a choreographer, director, curator, writer and performance artist. In April 2018, she founded HEIDCO in correlation with her Performance Opportunity Project at Gibney Dance NYC. This emerging NYC-based dance company currently is gaining momentum, seeking out new opportunities and broadening our network by participating in community-based showcases, festivals and critical discourse. In our first year we have shared work at Gibney Dance, Arts on Site, Jennifer Muller/The Works, and the NYC Poetry Festival on Governors Island.

HEIDCO launches its new season with an exciting February! Stay tuned for more updates and information as the campaign progresses!

What We Need

Friends! Lovers! Movers! Rather than raising funds for a specific performance or opportunity, we are hoping to gather as many small donations as possible. We want to share our process with as many individuals as possible, so that we can sustain an environment of creation, collaboration, feedback, and change. We hope that in making a donation, you will join us in making the space in which this is possible!

The funds raised from this campaign will also support rehearsal space, artist and collaborator fees, ad production costs for our upcoming work, METALBODY.

What You Get

$5 - 2 free company classes**

$10 - 3 free company classes

$15 - 4 free company classes

$20 - 4 free company classes & 20 second personalized music video from the company

$100 - Astrological Birth chart reading from our one and only Artistic Director

(Caitlin also works as a professional astrologer!)

 

**Caitlin's contemporary movement labs begin with simple technical devices, guided improvisation, and instant composition. Class focuses on peripheral awareness, rhythmic dynamic, intersection of spaces, and kinetic agreements, within solo material, duets, and ensemble work. This class is not a free-form improvisational atmosphere but rather a technical, specific, and studied practice for the dancer hoping to gain embodied composition and sequence, in real time.

There is a great sense of gratitude and responsibility that accompanies asking for support.

We Thank You For Every Ounce of Yours, and We Cannot Wait To Meet You.

 

Company Members:

Kristyn Archibald

Maggie Beutner

Kelsey Greenway

Lir Katz

Kelsey Lanceta

Collaborating Artists:

Erin Bishop O'brien

Zach Crumrine

Helena Grierson

Jordan Geiger

Delaney Mcdonough

Katie McCauley

Zack Vidal

Itohan Edoloyi

 

Video Credits:

Gibney Dance, Performance Opportunity Project, April 2018  

(filmed by Digital Technology Initiative)

NYC Poetry Festival/NYC Poetry Society, July 2018 (filmed by The Fleet)

Arts on Site, Performance Party October 2018

Hatch Performance Series, Jennifer Muller/The Works, October 2018

Prospect 4 @ Art Klub, New Orleans, March 2018 (filmed by Milo Daemgen)

Roy Edna Disney CalArts Theater, REDCAT Studio, March 2016

story:
«Metti le ali al talento»: aiutaci a far volare il sogno di tanti giovani talenti della danza italiana

(English version below)

 

Il nostro progetto 

«La danza è scoperta, scoperta, scoperta.» Martha Graham 

Si sente spesso parlare di quanto la danza sia fondamentale nella crescita degli individui, in particolare dei bambini, perché agisce sullo sviluppo dell’equilibrio e della coordinazione, sulla padronanza dello spazio, sul potenziamento della memoria visiva e della capacità d’intuito. Ciò che impariamo danzando rimarrà con noi per sempre nella nostra memoria e ci guiderà per il resto della vita, anche senza accorgercene! 

La danza per tutti dunque. Ma per alcuni la danza è anche la visione di un futuro lavorativo: sono tanti i giovani studenti che investono in questa grande passione per trasformarla in una professione, e tanti di loro non trovano in Italia le possibilità giuste per sviluppare e potenziare le proprie capacità, ma decidono di cercarle fuori. Il progetto «Metti le ali al talento» nasce proprio da qui, dall’esigenza di offrire occasioni per la crescita professionale di questi giovani talenti italiani dando loro la possibilità di spiccare il volo all’estero per trasformarsi in grandi artisti o per vivere un’esperienza formativa che li caratterizzerà per tutta la vita.

Per realizzare il nostro progetto abbiamo bisogno di 6.000,00 euro! E anche tu puoi contribuire! 

 

Come utilizzeremo il vostro contributo

Grazie a questo progetto e al vostro contributo saranno create delle borse di studio per giovani studenti e talenti italiani al fine di aiutare le loro famiglie a sostenere gli studi all’estero. 

Il numero di borse di studio da assegnare sarà valutato in base a quanto riusciremo a raccogliere: più fondi raccoglieremo più possibilità daremo a questi ragazzi! 

Abbiamo bisogno del vostro sostegno per raggiungere il nostro obiettivo di 6.000,00 euro e, perché no, magari anche superarlo grazie al coinvolgimento dei vostri amici! 

Tutto il team di Ateneo Danza è al lavoro da mesi per trasformare in realtà un sogno, una passione in futuro, lo studio in professione e per fare questo stiamo programmando tante iniziative all’insegna della bella danza. 

 

26 e 27 ottobre 2019: un weekend interamente dedicato alla grande danza 

Per promuovere il nostro progetto, oltre alla campagna di crowdfunding, abbiamo deciso di dare vita ad un evento straordinario dove la danza sarà protagonista per due giornate di workshop, masterclasses, audizioni e un Gran Galà Internazionale di danza ospitato sul palcoscenico del prestigioso Teatro A. Bonci di Cesena. Domenica 27 ottobre alle 20.45 sarà un grande piacere, orgoglio ed emozione rivedere i nostri talenti italiani esibirsi sul bellissimo palcoscenico di questo teatro prestigioso.  

Sono tanti gli interlocutori con cui stiamo dialogando e che stanno appoggiando il nostro progetto: l’Amministrazione Comunale ha prontamente capito l’unicità e l’importanza dell’evento ed ha dimostrato il suo appoggio concedendo il Patrocinio per questa bellissima manifestazione che si preannuncia essere un evento non certo solo regionale ma nazionale.

Durante lo spettacolo si esibiranno numerosi giovani danzatori italiani che sono volati all’estero con contratti offerti dalle compagnie più prestigiose al mondo e saranno consegnati i premi alla carriera a due ballerini considerati tra le eccellenze più importanti nell’attuale panorama mondiale della danza: Federico Bonelli (Royal Ballet) e Marianela Nunez (Royal Ballet) che riceveranno il premio direttamente dalle mani della signora della danza, Carla Fracci.  

Nell’arco della serata di esibiranno: 

  • MARIANELA NUNEZ, Royal Ballet 
  • FEDERICO BONELLI, Royal Ballet 
  • VALENTINO ZUCCHETTI, Primo Solista The Royal Ballet Company Londra (Inghilterra)
  • GIADA ROSSI, Solista Compagnia Nacional De Danza Madrid (Spagna)
  • LORENZO SILINGARDI, Ballerino SNG Opera Ballet Ljubiana (Slovenia)
  • ROSA PIERRO, Choryphée Polish Dance Company (Polonia)
  • RINALDO VENUTI, Solista Polish Dance Company (Polonia)
  • ALESSANDRO RIGA, Primo Ballerino Compagnia Nacional De Danza Madrid (Spagna)
  • HARUHI OTANI, Solista Compagnia National De danza Madrid (Spagna)
  • CHIARA RONTINI, Ballerina MIR Dance Company di Gelsenkirchen (Germania)
  • MM CONTEMPORARY DANCE COMPANY diretta da Michele Merola

 

Ma non finisce qui! 

In quel weekend si svolgeranno master classes per studenti di balletto con alcuni dei grandi nomi in programma come Federico Bonelli (Primo Ballerino Royal Ballet Company Londra), Valentino Zucchetti (Primo Solista Royal Ballet Company Londra), Pino Alosa (Ballet Master Internazionale).

Inoltre «Metti le Ali al Talento» è onorata di ospitare l’Audizione per il Corso Estivo della prestigiosa scuola American Ballet Theater con i Maestri Franco De Vita e Raymond Lukens.

Per tutte le informazioni relative agli eventi del 26 e 27 ottobre 2019 visitate il sito www.mettilealialtalento.it 
 

 

Ateneo Danza: ci presentiamo 

La scuola ATENEO DANZA nasce nel 1993 a Forlì e, fin dalla sua fondazione, svolge un'importante funzione di promozione della danza e costituisce un punto fermo di riferimento per tutti coloro che desiderano avvicinarsi al mondo della danza e delle arti in genere; l'alta preparazione, qualificazione e professionalità dei docenti e dei maestri ospiti è sicuramente la garanzia più importante che ha fatto crescere negli anni la realtà del centro.

ATENEO DANZA svolge anche una fondamentale azione di formazione e divulgazione nelle scuole del territorio di riferimento: da anni ormai collabora con grande successo con alcune scuole materne ed elementari della città per avviare progetti di inserimento della danza all'interno di tali strutture, in collaborazione con le insegnanti di attività motoria.

Il grande punto di forza della scuola è la stretta collaborazione con docenti e direttori provenienti dalle principali accademie professionali internazionali, grazie ai quali gli allievi hanno la possibilità di aprire gli orizzonti e fare tesoro di grandi insegnamenti. Grazie a queste magnifiche opportunità negli ultimi anni tanti, tantissimi studenti hanno lasciato ATENEO DANZA per inseguire un sogno internazionale e diversi di loro, già diplomati, sono ora affermati professionisti in carriera.

www.ateneodanza.it

_____________________

English version

 

LET’S GIVE THIS TALENT WINGS: Dance scholarships. 

Help us fund scholarships for talented young Italian dancers!

 

OUR PROJECT

“Dancing is just discovery, discovery, discovery.” ― Martha Graham

 

We often hear how essential dance is for growth, especially that of children. Indeed, it develops balance and coordination, helps master the concept of space and enhances both visual memory and intuition.

What we learn through dance will stay with us forever, guiding us for the rest of our lives without us even realising!

Dance is for everyone, of course, but for some it is also the vision of a working future. Countless young students invest in this great passion, trying to turn it into a profession. Not finding the right opportunity to develop and enhance their skills in Italy, many decide to look abroad.

The “Let’s give this talent wings” project was created for this reason, from a need to offer talented young Italian dancers the chance to develop their professional skills and take flight, going abroad both to become great artists and for educational experiences that characterise them for life.

We need €6000 to develop this project - and you can donate, too!

 

HOW WE WILL USE YOUR DONATION

 

We will create scholarships for talented young Italian students through the project and with your donation, thus helping families support their studies abroad.

The number of scholarships to be awarded will be decided based on how much we collect: the more funds we have, the more opportunities we’ll be able to give these youngsters!

We need your support to reach our goal of €6000 and why not, collect even more if you involve your friends, too!

The staff of LET’S GIVE THIS TALENT WINGS has been working for months to turn a dream into reality, planning a whole host of dance events in order to do so.

 

26th-27th OCTOBER 2019: a weekend dedicated to the beauty of dance

 

Besides a crowdfunding campaign, we decided to create an amazing event to promote our project. Two days of dance workshops, masterclasses and auditions will end with an International Grand Gala of dance hosted on the stage of the prestigious Bonci Theatre in Cesena.

It will be with great pleasure, as well as pride and excitement, that we will watch talented Italian students performing on the beautiful stage of this prestigious theatre in Cesena on Sunday 27th October at 8.45p.m..

We’ve been talking to a lot of people, many of whom are backing our project. The Municipality of Cesena, for example, has understood the uniqueness and importance of what we’re doing and shown its support by granting us Patronage for this extraordinary event. Indeed, it’s being announced as one that is not only regional but national and international, too!

Many young Italian dancers who have flown abroad after signing contracts with some of the most prestigious dance companies in the world will perform during the show. Moreover, career prizes will be awarded to two dancers considered to be amongst the most important on the current world dance scene: Federico Bonelli (The Royal Ballet) and Marianela Núñez (The Royal Ballet) who, along with many other extraordinary professional dancers, will receive their awards from Ms. Carla Fracci.
